The Palestinian Authority becomes the 123rd member of the International Criminal Court. The move gives the court jurisdiction over alleged crimes in Palestinian territories. The Palestinians signed the Rome Statute in January. Israel and the United States opposed the Palestinians' efforts to join.
At least 607 people were executed around the world in 2014, compared to 778 in 2013. The number of executions worldwide has gone down by almost 22% on the previous year. The U.S. remains one of the worst offenders for imposing capital punishment.
Amnesty International releases its annual review of the death penalty worldwide. Last year, we recorded executions in 22 countries, down by almost a half from 20 years ago. The number of executions recorded around the world dropped significantly in 2014 compared with the previous year, from 778 to 607.

Astronomers estimate there are perhaps 40 billion Earth-like, habitable-zone planets in our Milky Way galaxy alone. Geophysicists have long monitored how fast the Earth's plates are moving. India is being driven slowly but surely underneath Nepal and Tibet at a speed of around 1.8 inches per year. Over millions of years, the squeezing has crushed the Himalayas like a concertina, raising mountains to heights of several miles.

Sustainable development is a doctrine that says: Let us once again place the economy on a true moral foundation and keep greed within bounds. The idea of sustainable development is that an economy must satisfy all three principles: economic growth, social fairness and environmental sustainability. This balanced approach is much harder to achieve.
Nearly 300 schoolgirls were abducted by Boko Haram on April 14, 2014. Malala Yousafzai calls on the Nigerian government to do more to rescue the girls. The Nobel Peace Prize winner survived an attack by the Taliban.
Two African-Americans are elected to the Ferguson City Council. It's the first city election since Michael Brown was killed by a white police officer last August. There's widespread feeling, especially in the African-American community, that low turnout will hurt turnout.
Iran and six world powers agree to continue nuclear negotiations under a "joint comprehensive plan of action" It paves the way for a much broader deal by end of June that guarantees the peaceful nature of Tehran's nuclear activities. The deal represents the biggest chance of rapprochement between Tehran and Washington.

Yarmouk, the largest Palestinian refugee camp in Syria, was formed in 1957 to accommodate people fleeing the Arab-Israeli conflict. The camp has been engulfed in fighting between the Syrian government and armed groups since December 2012. As many as 5,000 people have tried to flee their homes since ISIS stormed camp.

The Sleep Health Foundation have released a study reporting that 30 percent of Australians complain about their lack of sleep on a daily basis. The average adult needs around eight hours of sleep per night with a range of seven to nine. Any less than six or any more than 10 hours is unusual for the standard person. Professor David Hillman advises napping throughout the day.

Brady Eaves, 18, was filmed biting the head off a live hamster during a drunken spring break party in Florida last weekend. His stepfather is John Arthur Eaves Jr, who was the Democratic candidate in Mississippi's 2007 gubernatorial elections. Eaves' stepfather and mother have branded his actions 'disturbing' and 'disappointing' He has been withdrawn from the University of Mississippi, where he was on a scholarship, and submitted for mental health tests. Phi Delta Theta fraternity has openly condemned his actions and expelled him from the fraternity. The footage could see Eaves charged with felony animal cruelty charges, which carry a maximum jail term of five years and $5,000 fines.

The squad had originally been set to leave northern Italy immediately after the game but a technical issue with their plane delayed their flight. England's plane landed in Manchester to allow their northern-based players and staff to disembark before moving on to London on Wednesday .

The Glass House in Chislehurst, south east London, was designed and built as a Cold War bunker in 1951. It was built to accomodate civil servants in the event of a nuclear attack and was built with five foot thick concrete walls. The property, known as the Glass House, has now been put on the market for £3.5million  .

New rules mean every passenger in a car or coach will have their passport scanned. British Airways warns of 'significant disruption'

The Wyong Roos rugby league player was treated at the scene by paramedics before he went into cardiac arrest but later died. A 20-year-old man was arrested on Monday night and charged with murder. Police say the attack was 'unprovoked' and described him as a 'good citizen' . Family and friends have paid tribute to a 'top bloke' who loved travelling, sports and parties .

Lauren Hill, 19, was diagnosed with DIPG (Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma) during her senior year of high school. It is a rare form of brain cancer with a survival rate of less than 10 percent. She made it through a full season at Mount St. Joseph University in Cincinnati while raising more than $1.5 million for research. Her mother Lisa updates her followers on Facebook about her daughter's progress.
Playing video games may not only improve the ability to perform visual tasks, but also the learning ability for those skills, a study has claimed. The research was carried out by scientists at Brown University in Rhode Island. Research found that gaming boosts the. ability to learn a number of tasks more accurately, and possibly puts gamers in an 'expert category' of problem solving. The exact neural mechanisms underlying visual learning are unknown.

Jack Johnson beat Tommy Burns to win the world heavyweight title in 1908. It was the first time a black man had ever held sport's greatest prize. But it would take over six years before he would be defeated by Jess Willard, 6ft 6in 6in, in 1915. The fight took place in Havana, Cuba on April 5, 1915, 100 years ago.

The 5.45 acre estate in San Clemente, California was bought by the former Commander in Chief in 1969. Nixon entertained 17 heads of state at the home, which was built in 1926 and overlooks the Pacific Ocean. On Friday, police arrested 21-year-old Lafonzo Leonard Iracks and charged him in connection to Ivy's slaying. Iracks is facing a first-degree murder charge.
Alaska Department of Fish and Game Biologist Tom Seaton led 100 wood bison to freedom on a snowmobile. Wood bison are North America’s largest land mammal, but the native Alaskan species disappeared from the state 100 years ago.
Action shot was taken at Estavayer-le-Lac in Switzerland where the latest water sports craze of Jet Surfing has taken off. Jet surf boards have a top speed of 33mph and weigh just 15kg and have a two-stroke engine.

Richie Benaud, 84, died on Friday after a long battle with skin cancer. The cricket commentary box legend revealed last year that he was receiving radiation treatment. He said he believed the cancers were caused by playing cricket in the sun without a hat or sunscreen. Benaud urged all Australians to wear a cap to protect themselves from the sun .

Jeanetta Riley, 35, a mother-of-three daughters was killed last July after she brandished a knife at two cops outside of a hospital in Sandpoint, Idaho. She was taken to the hospital by her husband, Shane, 44, after he heard her fiddling with blades and talking about killing herself and stabbing people. The couple were homeless and living out of a 1996 Chevrolet van parked next to a lake. She pulled a knife from under the car seat featuring a three-and-a-half-inch blade and was confronted by police before she was shot and killed. Officers Michael Valenzuela, 27 and Skyler Ziegler, 29 were cleared of any wrongdoing in November .

Cousins was supposed to appear in court to face reckless driving charges on Wednesday morning but he failed to show up. His lawyer claimed the former West Coast Eagles captain had conflicting medical appointments. The magistrate had ordered Cousins to produce written evidence of the conflicting appointments before 4pm WST or an arrest warrant issued.

Malky Mackay has been sacked by Wigan Athletic after just five months in charge. The Latics lost 2-0 at home to Derby County on Monday night, leaving them eight points off the relegation zone. Wigan must win their next two games against Fulham and Millwall to stand any chance of survival. Gary Caldwell is expected to be handed the job on a temporary basis .

Real Madrid remain top of La Liga with nine points from three games.

Marquinhos made it 2-2 before half-time with a superb curling effort from the edge of the box to make it 3-2 . Ibrahimovic was involved in both goals, though not perhaps in the way that would be expected . PSG came from 2-1 down to win the game  .
ISIS fighters can be seen hammering and drilling away at sculptures and stone slabs believed to be 3,000 years old. The ancient Assyrian city of Nimrud is located near the Islamic State-controlled city of Mosul. The seven-minute video shows militants destroying the relics before bulldozing and blowing up the ruins, completely obliterating the historic site.

HLN's The Daily Share highlights the shocking price differences between near-identical products and services offered to women and men. The practice of 'invisible tax' is legal in almost every state in the US - even when the products or services are exactly the same for both genders.

When they reported the ordeal to school officials, they were told to 'suck it up' . They filed a $2.5 million federal suit against the school district in 2013. On Thursday a judge ordered each girl receive $75,000.

Eric Harris, 44, was shot dead by Robert Bates, 73, in Tulsa, Oklahoma, on April 2. Deputies were chasing after him after he fled during a sting operation in a nearby parking lot. He had allegedly been caught trying to buy drugs and a gun from cops posing as dealers. Bates, a reserve officer, ran up to Harris in a bid 'to get the situation under control' But he mistakenly fired his gun instead of his Taser, according to police. After firing one round into Harris, Bates said: 'Oh, I shot him! I'm sorry'

Deanna Robinson, of Quinlan, Texas, was 38 weeks pregnant when she says she was struck at least three times at her parents' home. She said deputies and state workers from Child Protective Services were present to remove her 18-month-old son because of allegations of abuse or neglect following a fight between her and her husband. Robinson spent six days in jail after being charged with resisting arrest.

The 14-time major winner recently dropped out of the world's top 100 rankings for the first time since September 1996 .
Amanda Peake Glover was a devoted youth ministry teacher and choir singer who'd only one month before had completed the Myrtle Beach marathon with her brother. She was rushed by ambulance to a nearby hospital but was soon pronounced dead. She is survived by her husband Benjamin, daughters Hope, Reagan and Caroline.

Richie Benaud, 84, was farewelled at a small private funeral in Sydney on Wednesday. His wife, Daphne, kept the details of where and when his funeral service would be held so under wraps. Even immediate family members said they didn't know the location of the service. Prime Minister Tony Abbott made the offer of a state funeral, which Mrs Benaud politely declined  .

Video features gay couple Jared Milrad and Nate Johnson, who are planning a summer wedding. Milrad, 31, says it shows how far U.S. social attitudes have changed in recent years .

She was bushwalking with a male friend and her two children, aged 12 and 13, when she dropped her phone. Sally and Stephen Morley are one of 1,500 couples in Britain who have had babies using EmbryoScope technology. The technology allows medics to record the microscopic miracle of life from fertilisation to the division of cells. It is also helping scientists learn more about the IVF process and how embryos form  .

He was the second officer to arrive at the scene of the death of Walter Scott, 50, and did not report Michael Slager's actions leading up to the shooting. Slager, 33, is thought to have falsified a report on the circumstances that led to Scott's death. He has been fired from the North Charleston police and charged with murder.

Lauren Hill, 19, was diagnosed with Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) shortly after her 18th birthday. She passed away at Cincinnati Children's Hospital on Friday morning. LeBron James posted an emotional farewell letter to Lauren via Twitter on Friday, just hours after she passed away. He praised her for the 'leadership', 'courage' and 'strength' she had shown while suffering from the cancer. The Cleveland Cavaliers player signed off the letter: 'Sincerely, LeBron James' The letter has since been retweeted tens of thousands of times, with many calling it 'touching and 'beautiful'

The California Department of Corrections has set up several Sensitive Needs Housing Units to protect former gang members from gangs. The units provide a safer environment, free from gang activity, and the transition out of gang membership is dramatic. Inmates of different races and gang affiliations mix during their daily exercise and in the cafeteria during lunch in stark contrast to segregation  .

Strong storms rumbled through the Southern Plains early on Thursday, missing major population centers but offering a preview of bad weather that could hit Chicago, Detroit and other big cities in the Midwest later in the day. The storm system, which stretches from Texas up to the Great Lakes and down to North Carolina, has the potential to be the biggest severe weather event so far this spring. Hail of up to 4 inches in diameter smashed buildings and cars and high winds tore off roofs and downed trees, as wild weather hit 12 states. Tornadoes were reported on Wednesday and early Thursday in Kansas, Missouri and Oklahoma.

But instead of ordering her back to the spot, she awarded a free-kick to Norway. UEFA chiefs ruled the match should be replayed and it was replayed five days later .

Lauren Hill was diagnosed with Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma, a rare form of brain cancer, shortly after her 18th birthday. She played four games for Mount St. Joseph University in Cincinnati and raised more than $1.5 million for research into the cancer. But as her condition worsened, she became an honorary coach and earlier this year, she moved to Cincinnati Children's Hospital, where she passed away on Friday morning. She was 19 years old .

Dustin Johnson became the first man ever to have three eagles in one round at the Masters . The 21-year-old set a new 36-hole record total of 14 under par, beating the old mark of 13 under set by Ray Floyd . Tiger Woods shot a commendable 69, his first score in the sixties in 15 rounds in majors .

Author Martin Fletcher claims the devastating fire was not an accident and has revealed a sequence of other blazes at businesses owned by or associated with Stafford Heginbotham, the club's chairman at the time. West Yorkshire police today said they would review any fresh evidence surrounding the tragedy. The fire broke out near half-time of Bradford's game against Lincoln on May 11, 1985. It was the worst stadium fire in the history of British football and left 56 dead.
The fire began around 11:30 a.m. Sunday on Tupper Street in downtown Buffalo, WGRZ reported. Police evacuated two buildings as smoke came out of manholes. A Buffalo Fire Department official said the second of three explosions sent one of the manhole covers 200 to 300 feet into the air. There were no injuries  .

The group deliberated for 35 hours over the course of a week, and decided that certain aspects of the case warranted a life in prison without the possibility of parole.

The video was recorded by an 'internal whistle-blower' and released by the company to reporters . It comes days after the trainer's release of a book criticizing the company's treatment of animals. In the five-minute video he discusses an incident in which five black men allegedly threw a rock at a woman speaking on the other line that hit her in the head . The trainer, who also featured prominently in the CNN documentary Blackfish, says SeaWorld is mounting a smear campaign against him to distract from his message.

YouTube user Elman511 cracked open the over-sized egg that was laid by one of his hens. He exclaimed: ‘The big egg has another normal egg in it!’. While the instance is extremely rare, it’s caused when the hen is in the process of forming an egg in her oviduct and another oocyte – the ovum or egg cell that becomes the yolk of the egg – is released too soon .

Fish die-offs are a frequent occurrence in Rio's waterways, which are choked with raw sewage and rubbish. The latest incident began several days ago at the Rodrigo de Freitas lake, where the Olympic canoeing and rowing events are to be held. The city's waste management company have been brought in to clear the lake.
Last of the riders went through the barrier eight seconds before the TGV train arrived at the Waller crossing. One rider was even clipped by the barrier as it came down, as the racers hurry through with the train.

When Sam Schmidt became paralyzed from the neck down after crashing during testing in Orlando in 2000, his team thought he would never walk, let alone, drive again. But he defied the odds last spring, driving on the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. The modified car includes integrated advanced electronics and a human-to-machine interface which allows quadriplegics to safely operate the vehicle .

Derry Mathews beat Tony Luis at Echo Arena in Liverpool on Saturday night. Mathews won the interim WBA lightweight title with a unanimous points decision. Luis was drafted in after Richar Abril and Ismael Barroso both pulled out of the fight .
Manny Pacquiao's trainer Freddie Roach says Floyd Mayweather cannot be considered the best ever. Roach rates super middleweight star Andre Ward and middleweight sensation Gennady Golovkin above the undefeated American .
Paddy Barnes and Michael Conlan are one win away from qualifying for Rio 2016. The pair are currently competing in the World Series of Boxing in Maiquetia, Venezuela. Barnes and Conlan have travelled 34,000 miles in 13 weeks to make it to the Olympics. Click here for more boxing news .
Nicola Adams is hoping to become a double Olympic gold medallist in Rio next year. The 32-year-old is preparing to return to an English ring for the first time since her London 2012 triumph in Liverpool .
Jordan Spieth beat Justin Rose and Phil Mickelson to win The Masters on Sunday. The 21-year-old equalled Tiger Woods' 72-hole record and became the first man to get to 19-under par. Jack Nicklaus believes it is time for the 'young guys to take over'
Caroline Wozniacki was forced to defend herself after she congratulated Jordan Spieth on Twitter. Spieth won the first major of his career with a four-shot victory in the Masters at Augusta . The tennis star was quick to ensure fans it wasn't a dig at her former love interest Rory McIlroy.
Gael Monfils beat Roger Federer 6-4, 7-6 in a thrilling last-16 encounter at the Monte Carlo Masters. The Frenchman will face Grigor Dimitrov in the quarter-finals of the tournament. The world No 18 hit 22 winners to Federer's 17 .
Roger Federer beat Jeremy Chardy 6-2, 6-1 to reach the last 16 of the Monte Carlo Masters. Federer has changed his schedule this year to allow more time for recovery and training. Click here for more.
Lewis Hamilton and Nico Rosberg left Shanghai after the Chinese Grand Prix arguing over the rights and wrongs of how they raced. But Hamilton insists he will do his talking 'on the track' ahead of Sunday's race in the desert of Bahrain .
Mike Tindall's horse Monbeg Dude finished third in the Grand National at Aintree. The former England rugby captain was beaming from ear-to-ear after watching his horse run his heart out in the race  .
Billy Vunipola cleared of intentionally headbutting Leicester full back Mathew Tait. RFU disciplinary panel dismisses charge that England No 8 recklessly led with his head. Saracens will face Clermont Auvergne in Saturday's Champions Cup semi-final.
Saracens face Clermont in the Champions Cup semi-final on Saturday. Billy Vunipola was cited on Monday night for an alleged butt on Leicester's Mathew Tait. Toulon are plotting a move for Australia fly-half Quade Cooper after missing out on Sale's Danny Cipriani.
James Anderson claimed his 384th Test wicket on the final day of the first Test in Antigua. The 32-year-old broke Sir Ian Botham's record which had stood for 23 years . Anderson believes he can still improve as a bowler for England  .
Michael Clarke believes Kevin Pietersen could play in this summer's Ashes Test series. The 34-year-old has not played for England since the fifth Test in Sydney. Pietersen has signed for Surrey with the intent of scoring runs.
MCC plans to replace the 'tired' Tavern and Allen stands at Lord's with a single new structure with 5,500 seats. The redevelopment will increase the overall capacity of Lord's to almost 30,000. The 'Masterplan' has a projected budget of £80million.
Siobhan-Marie O'Connor won gold in the 200m individual medley at the British Championships. Her time of two minutes 09:51 seconds was the fastest recorded in the world this year. The 19-year-old is the reigning Commonwealth champion .
Harry Redknapp resigned as QPR manager in February citing knee problems. The 68-year-old says he would consider a return to management as long as it's at the right club. Former West Ham boss spoke at a charity match.
Mauricio Pochettino unsure whether planned boycott by Newcastle fans will help or hinder Tottenham. Newcastle fans are staging a mass protest against the current regime at St James' Park. Spurs travel to Newcastle in the Premier League on Sunday.
Celtic face Inverness in the Scottish Cup semi-final at Hampden Park on Sunday. The match will take place at 12:15, a time that Scottish football fans do not agree with. Ronny Deila believes teams should have more of a say on kick-off times .
Karim Benzema set to miss Real Madrid's Champions League clash against Atletico Madrid. French striker missed Saturday's 3-1 win against Malaga with a knee injury. Carlo Ancelotti 'hesitating' between playing 4-4-2 or 4-3.

Roy Hodgson has been impressed with Austin's consistency this season . The QPR forward will be monitored by England boss Roy Hodgon for the remainder of the campaign.

Danny Ings is out of contract at Burnley and is a target for top clubs. West Ham's Aaron Cresswell is wanted by Manchester City and Chelsea .

Manchester City must have eight homegrown players in their Premier League squad of 25. Homegrown players can be born overseas as long as they have been at a club's academy three years before the age of 21. The Champions League squads of 25 also require eight players to have been trained in England, but four must be homegrown.

Bail was set at over £2,000 for each of them but they also agreed to surrender their passports. They will also continue to work for the Royal Navy and draw their current pay  .

Russia beat Montenegro 3-0 in a Euro 2016 qualifier in Podgorica on March 27. The game was abandoned after 67 minutes following a pitch brawl between fans and players. UEFA have ordered Montenegro to play their next two games behind closed doors. One of those matches is suspended for two years while the nation are fined £36,280.
Marouane Fellaini opened the scoring for Manchester United with a thumping header in the 14th minute. Ashley Young equalised for City in the 28th minute with a close-range free-kick. Sergio Aguero gave the visitors hope in the 88th minute, tapping David Silva's cross into the empty net. Juan Mata made it 3-1 with a header after 67 minutes to give the Red Devils an advantage they never looked like relinquishing. Chris Smalling added a fourth to make it 4-1 in the 73rd minute. Aguero completed the scoring in the 89th minute to seal victory .
Chelsea beat Manchester City 3-1 in the FA Youth Cup final first-leg on Monday night. City captain Vincent Kompany, manager Manuel Pellegrini and head of youth development Patrick Vieira were in attendance. Chelsea are currently top of the Premier League table .
Monaco lost 1-0 to Juventus in their Champions League quarter-final first leg on Tuesday. Leonardo Jardim's side were awarded a penalty after Alvaro Morata was fouled by Ricardo Carvalho. Juventus midfielder Arturo Vidal scored the winner from the spot .
Chelsea are believed to have made an offer for FC Tokyo forward Yoshinori Muto. The 22-year-old would be the first Japanese player to sign for Chelsea if he completes a move to Stamford Bridge. Chelsea agreed a £200million sponsorship deal with Japanese tyre manufacturers Yokohama Rubber in February. Jose Mourinho insists commercial deals would never fully dictate his transfer policy.
Patrick Bamford won the Championship Player of the Year award on Sunday. The Chelsea loanee has scored 17 goals for Middlesbrough this season. The 21-year-old hopes to be part of Gareth Southgate's England squad.

Quigg wants to fight Frampton at Manchester Arena on July 18. Cyclone Promotions say they are awaiting formal communication from Hearn's Matchroom before renewing negotiations.

The Daily Telegraph in Australia had a special tribute edition with the headline 'A marvellous innings' The Weekend Australian went with 'the voice of our endless summers falls silent' while The Age simply had a picture of Benaud.
Arsenal beat Reading 1-1 on penalties in the FA Cup semi-final after extra-time. Alexis Sanchez's shot from close range squirmed through Adam Federici's legs in the 106th minute. The Reading goalkeeper left the field in tears as manager Steve Clarke tried to console him. Arsenal will now face either Liverpool or Aston Villa in the final of the competition next month .
Newcastle face Tottenham at St James' Park on Sunday afternoon in the Premier League. The Toon fans are planning to boycott the game in protest against owner Mike Ashley . John Carver has called on the advice of Alan Pardew and Alan Shearer for advice . Carver was in the dugout with Pardews at the end of last season when fans booed him at Cardiff  .
Newcastle United fans stayed away from Sunday's match against Tottenham Hotspur. Protest group AshleyOut.com had urged fans to boycott the game. Several hundred gathered outside of St James' Park before kick-off. Supporters are upset at what they see as a lack of investment and ambition.
Manchester City beat West Ham 2-0 at the Etihad Stadium on Saturday afternoon. James Collins scored an own goal and Sergio Aguero scored his 20th Premier League goal of the season. Frank Lampard started his fifth Premier League game for City and impressed in midfield .
Rafa Benitez is set to leave Napoli this summer and will have a host of clubs after his services. He was made Chelsea interim manager in 2012 but the fans never warmed to him. He got the best out of his squad for the rest of the season and got Fernando Torres back to his best. Manchester City are one possible destination and Newcastle are another .
Winston Reid says West Ham no longer suffer from fear of facing Manchester City. City had won their last five games against the Hammers by an aggregate score of 14-1. West Ham suffered just their second league defeat of the season at Upton Park in October. Manuel Pellegrini's side have lost six of their last eight games.

Chelsea beat Manchester United 1-0 at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. Blues held the ball for just 29 per cent of the match, their lowest total since 2006. Jose Mourinho says he is unconcerned by statistics and only cares about the points .
Carlo Ancelotti has been linked with a return to the Premier League this summer. The Real Madrid boss says he expects to remain at the Bernabeu for at least another year. Barcelona, Real, Atletico Madrid and Valencia all play within six hours of each other on Saturday. Click here for more La Liga news .

The Uruguayan striker nutmegs David Luiz for the second time in the second half to complete the rout. PSG defender Luiz was forced off with a hamstring injury just 10 minutes into the game . Lionel Messi, Neymar and Luis Suarez have scored more goals than any other team away from home this season.

Luis Suarez has scored 19 goals in all competitions for Barcelona since joining the club this season. The Uruguayan striker admits he was nervous at the prospect of playing alongside Neymar. Barcelona face Paris Saint-Germain at the Nou Camp.
Barcelona president Josep Maria Bartomeu says the club are 'very happy' with Luis Enrique. The 44-year-old only took charge of the club last summer, signing a two-year deal. Enrique's side beat Valencia 2-0 on Saturday.

His son Kilian, Peter Ueblacker and Lutz Hansel, who are all part of the team at Bayern, have also resigned. The 72-year-old medical professional said 'the bond of trust is damaged' and called the blame centred at his department 'inexplicable'   .

Jonathan Pitre, 14, was born with Epidermolysis Bullosa - or 'butterfly skin' - which means his skin is as fragile as a butterfly's wing. One in every 17,000 people in the UK has the genetic condition. Unless a cure is found, Jonathan will likely only live to 25. But he is trying his best to 'live in the moment'

Rudy Gestede opened the scoring for Blackburn in the 78th minute. Jordan Rhodes added a second in injury time to make it 2-0. Neil Harris' side are now four points adrift of fourth-bottom Rotherham with two games to play   .
Floyd Mayweather has earned more than $400million in his boxing career. The undefeated boxer has a vast collection of super cars, private jets and jewellery. Mayweather has bought over 100 cars over the last 18 years, including 16 Rolls-Royces . The boxer has also posted pictures of his private jet worth £30m and his expensive jewellery collection  .

Just minutes after 8pm UK time, all tickets for the bout began appearing on the secondary market. One ticket for $128,705 (£85,508) went for a cool $7,924 (£5,265) on StubHub on Thursday night . All fixtures in the Premier League and Football League will observe a minute's silence for the 56 supporters who died in the devastating blaze. The inferno ripped through Valley Parade on May 11, 1985 during the first half of a game against Lincoln City, before which Bradford had received the Third Division title. Players, managers and fans will stand for a minute to mark the 30th anniversary of the disaster, which also left 265 injured .

French free diver jumped into Dean's Blue Hole in the Bahamas. Guillame Néry is seen at the edge before taking the plunge into the hole. The hole is 660ft (200 metres) deep, although he doesn't go to the bottom. Free divers are able to hold their breath for more than 20 minutes. The video was filmed in 2010 by the Frenchman's girlfriend and fellow freediver Julie Gautier at Dean’s Blue Hole.
An analogue promotional watch from Apple with a blue bezel, rubber strap and colourful hands, is listed on the internet auction site with a ‘buy it now’ price of $2,499.99 (£1,707.47) plus postage. For the same price as the 1997 timepiece, Apple fans could pre-order five of the cheapest Apple Watch Sport, which cost £299 in the UK and still have some change. It is still cheaper than the Apple Watch Edition, which costs upwards of £8,000 ($10,000) .
A deleted tweet by Musk says that the rocket appeared to be suffering from 'stiction in the biprop throttle valve, resulting in control system phase lag' This means the valve controlling the flow propellent and oxidiser to the engine wasn't moving fast enough. As a result, the actions from rocket's computers couldn't be acted upon in time to correct the tilt.

Four houses in the town were washed away in the raging murky storm waters while a horse was rescued from drowning by a woman in a tin boat. Some people ignored warnings from authorities to stay out of the water as wild storms lashed the eastern coast of Australia around Sydney, such as these two teenagers who took on the surf at swimming baths at Bronte Beach in Sydney .

Victor Moses has returned to Chelsea for treatment after injuring his hamstring against West Ham. The winger has been on loan at Stoke but is expected to be out for six weeks. Stoke are still interested in tying up a permanent deal for Moses .
Chelsea will announce the £4.5million signing of Brazilian wonderkid Nathan on Wednesday. The 19-year-old will join fellow Brazilians Willian, Ramires, Filipe Luis and Oscar at Stamford Bridge.
Swansea have made a contract offer to Marseille striker Andre Ayew. The 25-year-old Ghana international is out of contract in the summer and free to talk to foreign clubs. Swansea have also expressed an interest in Schalke full-back Christian Fuchs .
Arsenal may pull out of the running to sign Raheem Sterling following recent events . The 20-year-old is stalling on a new £100,000-per-week contract at Liverpool. Arsene Wenger has condemned Jack Wilshere and Wojciech Szczesny .
Gareth Bale has been linked with a move to Manchester United in recent weeks. Real Madrid legend Zinedine Zidane insists Bale will not be sold this summer. Bale joined Real Madrid for a world record £86million from Tottenham Hotspur in 2013 .
Manchester City have decided to listen to offers for Yaya Toure and Samir Nasri this summer. The Premier League champions are also open to allowing Nasri to leave the Etihad Stadium. CLICK HERE for all the latest Manchester City news .
Swansea City have expressed an interest in signing Schalke defender Christian Fuchs. The 29-year-old is out of contract in the summer and is keen on a move to the Premier League. West Bromwich Albion are also interested in signing him.
Tottenham will offer Nabil Bentaleb a new deal in order to ward off interest from other clubs. The Algerian midfielder's current deal expires in the summer of 2018. Clubs from across Europe are monitoring the situation and could move if the talks continue to drag on.
Helal Abbas, 55, lost his bid to become mayor of Tower Hamlets in East London days after the claim appeared in an ethnic freesheet. The race was won by Lutfur Rahman, 50, a controversial figure who has been accused of rigging his re-election.
A time lapse video shows the water creeping along the tracks at Bardwell Park in Sydney's south. The murky flood water eventually submerges the train line and begins moving like a river past the platform. The flooding forced the partial closure of the T2 Airport line in Sydney. Sydney's two-day total rainfall totalled about 225mm by 9am Wednesday - the most in 17 years.
Gracie Joy Roseman died after she managed to move over the edge of her adjustable cot. A 'safety ridge' cut off the oxygen supply to her brain, West Sussex Coroner's Court heard. Coroner Penelope Schofield called for urgent action to be taken to prevent future deaths. The cot has a moveable panel on one side which can be folded down, leaving a ridge just 7cm high .

Dapper Laughs sprang to fame on video network Vine where he joked about how women couldn’t resist him. He came under fire last year after telling a female audience member at one of his shows she was 'gagging for a rape' .

Rudy Gestede has scored 20 goals in the Championship for Blackburn this season. Swansea, Crystal Palace, Hull and West Brom have all shown an interest in the £7million-rated forward .

Alan Pardew will target a marquee signing to boost Crystal Palace's profile this summer. Eagles boss is prepared to let star winger Yannick Bolasie leave for between 40 and 60 million pounds. Palace host Hull City at Selhurst Park on Saturday .
Josh Meekings will be allowed to play in the Scottish Cup final against Falkirk. The Inverness defender was cleared of a charge of deliberate handball against Celtic. The SFA judicial panel decided it was not entitled to apply retrospective punishment .
Lorient beat Marseille 5-3 at the Stade Velodrome to climb out of the Ligue 1 relegation zone. It was Lorient's first win in five games after a poor run of five games. Jordan Ayew scored twice for the Breton side  .
Ronald Koeman has promised not to leave Southampton this summer for a bigger club. The Dutchman has been a revelation in his first season in English football. Southampton only need a point to break their record Premier League points tally set last season  .
Tottenham are considering sharing their new £400m stadium with an NFL franchise. The north London club's new 65,000 capacity stadium could be better suited to the NFL than Wembley. The NFL is said to be within five years of having a franchise.
Carl Jenkinson says Jack Grealish should follow his heart when choosing between Ireland or England. The West Ham defender made the same decision in 2012 when he chose England over Finland. The 23-year-old defender is on loan from Arsenal until end of season.
West Ham became the first Premier League club to reduce season ticket prices this week. The Hammers will move to the Olympic Stadium from Upton Park next year. Manager Sam Allardyce says filling the stadium is the most important thing.
Mauricio Pochettino spent 16 months as Southampton manager before leaving for Tottenham. The Argentine has brought through a number of young players at the south coast club. Harry Kane has been in sensational form under the former Saints boss this season. Tottenham host Southampton at St Mary's on Sunday night .
Greg Hardy has been suspended without pay for 10 games for conduct detrimental to the National Football League. The decision follows a two-month NFL investigation that started after the dismissal of his domestic violence case. Hardy may appeal the NFL's decision within three days .
New England Patriots will host the Pittsburgh Steelers in the opening game of the season on September 10. Week one also features a prime-time showdown between the New York Giants and Dallas Cowboys. Seattle Seahawks will play the Green Bay Packers in a rematch of last season.

Charles Tillman has ended his 12-year career with the Chicago Bears. The 34-year-old cornerback has agreed a deal with the Carolina Panthers. Tillman was a staple of Lovie Smith's stingy defense during his time in Chicago.
Pittsburgh Steelers running back Le'Veon Bell will miss the first three games of the season. Bell will also be fined a game cheque for abusing the league's substance abuse policy. Bell was also charged with a DUI .

Denver Broncos cornerback Aqib Talib and his brother Yaqub are being investigated for aggravated assault. Talib was wanted on charges of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon in 2011 in Garland, Texas. He and his mother were accused of shooting a gun at his sister's live-in boyfriend. The charges were dropped because prosecutors believed the man was not a credible witness.
Sarah Thomas is the NFL's first full-time female referee. The 41-year-old was in the league's officiating development program in 2013-14. Shannon Eastin worked regular-season NFL games in 2012 as replacement.
LeSean McCoy was shipped to the Bills in exchange for linebacker Kiko Alonso last month. McCoy says Kelly's team has a college feel and that he doesn't like star talent. McCoy ran for 1,000 yards in four of six seasons with the Eagles .

Sarah Thomas is set to become the NFL's first full-time female official. The 42-year-old mother-of-three has officiated pre-season games as a line judge for the NFL.
Efe Obada played just five games for the London Warriors last season. The 22-year-old will fly out to Texas next month for rookie mini-camp. The 6ft 5in, 225-pound man mountain will play defensive end or tight end.
The Jacksonville Jaguars will bring the NFL Draft to London next month. A UK-based fan will announce their sixth and seventh round picks live on TV. It will be the first time the draft has taken place outside America.

Jack (19-1-1) received winning of 116-112 and 115-113, and the third had it even at 114-114. George Groves will fight Jack for the WBA world super- middleweight title as he is mandatory challenger.

Lewis Hamilton secured his 36th win of his career in Bahrain and his 21st from pole position. Kimi Raikkonen secured a record seventh podium finish in Bahrain, although the Ferrari driver has never won in the Gulf Kingdom. Bernie Ecclestone denied trying to engineer a deal for Hamilton to join Ferrari  .

Matt Giteau has not played for Australia since the 2011 World Cup in New Zealand. The Toulon fly half missed out on selection for the last World Cup due to injury . The 32-year-old has been in outstanding form for the French club this season . Gitesau is eligible to play for Australia again if he has 60 caps and seven years of professional service at home. The ARU will pick 'elite' players based abroad if they have 60 caps .

Players with 60 caps who have held professional contract with Australian Rugby for at least seven years will be eligible to continue their international careers. Other players based abroad will immediately become eligible if they commit to playing Super Rugby in Australia for the following two seasons  .
Mike Brown could miss the rest of the season after failing to recover from concussion. Brown was knocked out in the 13th minute of England's RBS 6 Nations match against Italy in February. The 29-year-old is still suffering from headaches and has taken no part in team meetings .

Alastair Cook and Jonathan Trott are the sixth English pair to score more than 100 runs together on 10 occasions. West Indies bowler Shannon Gabriel picked up where he left off after reaching 93mph on Wednesday. New Zealand all-rounder Corey Anderson could miss the Test series in England with a broken finger .
England posted 373 for six at stumps on day three of the second Test in Grenada . Joe Root's unbeaten 118 came with England posting a 74-run lead at the end of day three . Captain Alastair Cook got 76 in a century stand with Jonathan Trott (59) at the top . Gary Ballance's 77 boosted his 165-run partnership with Root, making it a very happy St George's Day . The end of the day was slightly marred by the loss of three quick wickets in the final session .
Marlon Samuels sent Ben Stokes on his way with a military-style salute on Thursday night. Stokes had given his wicket away just before the close of the third day. England closed on 373 for six, a lead of 74, thanks to an outstanding 118 from the prolific Joe Root .
England captain Alastair Cook has gone 34 innings and 697 days without a Test ton . Joe Root scored his sixth Test century and his first overseas on day three of the second Test against the West Indies . England ended on 373 for six, a lead of 74, and Root and Jos Buttler will have to stick around for as long as possible on Friday if England are going to dictate terms on the final day . The Yorkshireman is the fifth England batsman to score six consecutive 50s in Test innings . Root has featured in five of England’s past six Test partnerships of 150-plus runs . He has scored 1,037 runs since June 2014, averaging 103.7.
Stuart Broad took three wickets for 19 as England bowled West Indies out for 299. Alastair Cook and Jonathan Trott reached 74 without loss at stumps on day two. Broad produced his best bowling since knee surgery last year in Grenada  .

Reanne Evans saw her 10-year reign as women's world snooker champion come to a shock end. The 29-year-old lost 4-2 to Hong Kong's Ng On Yee in the semi-finals at the Northern Snooker Centre in Leeds .
Ding Jinhui was on for a maxumumum break of 147 before screwing back for the blue instead of the black. The Chinese world No 3 realised what he had done and started to giggle .
Chicago Bulls beat Milwaukee Bucks 91-82 to take a 2-0 lead in their first-round NBA play-offs series. Jimmy Butler scored a play-off career-high for the second straight game with 31 points against the Bucks .
The 2010 champion rattled in an opening break of 133 as he reeled off the three frames required to turn a 7-2 lead into a 10-2 victory. Robertson has committed more hours to the game than ever before.
Arsene Wenger wants Cesc Fabregas to be shown the 'respect he deserves' when he returns to Arsenal on Sunday. Wenger wants 'respect' for the club's former players and counts the Spaniard as a man who deserves that. Arsenal face Chelsea at the Emirates Stadium in the Premier League .
Gabriel Agbonlahor posted a video of himself performing a boxing workout with a trainer. The Aston Villa striker missed the FA Cup semi-final win against Liverpool because of a hamstring injury. Villa face Manchester City at the Etihad on Saturday in the Premier League.
Just nine points separates the bottom seven teams in the Premier League. Chris Ramsey believes QPR will avoid relegation if they win three more league games. Tim Sherwood believes his appointment at Aston Villa has given them more belief and confidence .
Danny Ings hasn't scored for Burnley since February 11 and is being linked with a move to Liverpool or Manchester United. Burnley manager Sean Dyche has called on the rest of his team-mates to share the goalscoring burden. The Clarets have scored just one goal in their last seven matches  .

Former Everton chairman Sir Philip Carter has died aged 87. Carter also served as president of the Football League and vice-president of the FA. Current Toffees Chairman Bill Kenwright also paid tribute to Sir Philip at Goodison Park.
Romelu Lukaku is Everton's top scorer in the Premier League this season with 18 goals. The 21-year-old says he dealt with racism as a youngster by using it as motivation. Lukaku hails work rate of strike partner Arouna.
Roberto Martinez wants to get the most out of Aaron Lennon's loan spell at Everton. The Tottenham winger has just four games remaining on loan at Goodison Park. Martinez said discussions about Lennon's future will come at end of season.
There are just four points separating the bottom five sides in the Premier League. Leicester, Burnley and QPR are all in the relegation zone, but Hull and Sunderland are teetering on the brink. Sportsmail's reporters give their verdicts on the closest relegation run-in for years. Can any of the bottom three climb to safety? Or will the clubs above them succumb to fiendishly difficult fixture lists?  .
Hull City were beaten 2-0 by Southampton at the St Mary's Stadium on Saturday. Steve Bruce's side are just two points clear of the Premier League relegation zone. Hull have six games to save their season and avoid relegation .
Esteban Cambiasso is wanted by Delhi Dynamos for India's I-League. The former Real Madrid and Inter Milan midfielder signed a one-year deal with Leicester last summer. Nigel Pearson is keen for the 34-year-old to stay .
Brendan Rodgers insists he is the man to guide Liverpool to success this season. The Liverpool manager is under pressure following the FA Cup semi-final defeat by Aston Villa. Rodgers has been boosted by the news that Jordan Henderson has committed his future to the club. Jordan Henderson signed a new five-year contract worth £100,000.
Steve McClaren is understood to be one of two people on Newcastle's short list for the head coach role. John Carver is the current incumbent at St James' Park. McClaren insists his sole focus is steering Derby to promotion .
John Carver says Newcastle's hierarchy must try to bring an end to protests against the club. The Magpies slumped to a sixth straight defeat at home to Spurs last weekend amid an atmosphere of unrest. Thousands of supporters boycotted the match at St James' Park in protest at a lack of ambition and investment from owner Mike Ashley .
Leroy Fer has not played since injuring his knee against Sunderland back in February. QPR manager Chris Ramsey admits the club are taking a chance on the Dutch midfielder. The club face West Ham in the London derby on Saturday night .
Queens Park Rangers are in the Premier League relegation zone with 28 points. Chris Ramsey's side face West Ham, Liverpool, Manchester City, Newcastle and Leicester. QPR lost 1-0 to Chelsea in their last game at Loftus Road.
Southampton fans plan to turn St Mary's orange to show support for Ronald Koeman. Mauricio Pochettino is returning to St Mary’s for the first time since leaving for Tottenham last year. The Saints face Spurs at White Hart Lane on Saturday .

Inverness defender Josh Meekings handled a goal-bound header from Celtic's Leigh Griffiths with his hand. Celtic wrote to the SFA to seek 'clarification' on the reasons for referee Steven McLean and his four assistants missing the first-half incident, when they were leading 1-0.

Usain Bolt wants to beat his own 200-metre world record by running the distance in under 19 seconds. The Jamaican sprinter ran the 200 metres in 19.19 sec at the 2009 World Championships in Berlin. Bolt is currently in Rio de Janeiro.

Bradford City's Valley Parade was destroyed by a fire on May 11, 1985. 56 people died and 265 were injured in the inferno at the football ground. Stuart McCall's father was one of the 56 people who died in the blaze. Rangers boss McCall has always declared himself and his father the fortunate ones of the tragedy.

Alexander Giniyatullin kept a remarkably steady hand filming the scary scene in the Kemerovo Region of Russia. The eerie phenomenon is called an 'earthflow' and is a rare type of landslide. It's a viscous flow of fine-grained materials, such as clay, sand and silt that have been saturated with water and moves downhill because of the pull of gravity. No one was hurt .

An Icelandic duo has created a snack that is made using cricket flour. Called the Jungle Bar it also contains dates, sesame seeds and chocolate. Cricket flour is said to be a good source of protein and other nutrients. The duo hopes it will encourage people in the West to eat more insects. It is being developed by Búi Bjarmar Aðalsteinsson and Stefán Atli Thoroddsen.

Kevin Mirallas rounded off a brilliant display of counter-attacking football to round off the win for Roberto Martinez's side. Louis van Gaal's side had appealed for offside against Romelu Lukaku in the first half .

Paula Radcliffe ran a time of 2:36.55 in her final competitive race on Sunday. The 41-year-old had barely run since February due to injury. The world record holder for 12 years said the time was irrelevant in the race. Radcliffe said the magic of London helped her run faster than she was capable of .

Santi Mina pulled one back for Celta before James Rodriguez made it 3-2 before half-time. James Rodriguez scored a late consolation to make it 4-3. Carlo Ancelotti's side are now just two points behind league leaders Barcelona at the top .
Javier Hernandez scored twice as Real Madrid beat Celta Vigo 4-2 at the Bernabeu on Sunday night. The Manchester United loanee has now scored six goals in eight starts for Real Madrid this season. Nolito opened the scoring for the visitors after nine minutes but Toni Kroos equalised for Carlo Ancelotti's side. Santi Mina put the visitors back in front on the half-hour mark with a header from a rebound . Hernandez scored his second and James Rodriguez's deflected shot made it 3-2 in the second half .

The Apple Watch Sport model has an Ion-X glass display which is supposed to be 'resistant to scratches and impact' In a video, TechRax drops the 42mm timepiece from a height of four feet (1.2 metres) It survived unscathed despite a nasty ‘crack’ noise when it hit the pavement. But when it landed on its face, the screen shattered instantly. Damage to the screen, such as chips, scratches or indeed shattering, is not covered by the watch's warranty .

The steel gate at Border Field State Park in California, which was put in place in the mid-1990s, was unlocked by officials in honor of Children's Day, a Mexican holiday that celebrates youngsters and family. For selected families, it was a long-awaited, intense experience. Two young boys reportedly fell to their knees as they crossed into Mexico and saw their cherished mother for the first time in two years. Many of the families were separated when relatives were deported to Mexico after living in the U.S.
43% of voters think Ed Miliband 'comes across as wanting to win the most' when compared to David Cameron. Only 25% think he wants to win most, compared to 43% who think he is most up for the fight. Opinion polls continue to suggest result too close.

The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham wants dog owners to submit a DNA sample from the inside of the animal's cheek. The council would then use stored information to match the animal responsible with any errant mess. The lab testing is believed to be 99.9 per cent accurate.

Evelyn Hutchins and Peter Rogers were expected to inherit the bulk of the fortune. But they discovered they had been disinherited after Mr Butcher's death .

Indonesian attorney-general H.M. Prasetyo praised the firing squad that executed Bali Nine pair Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran. He said that the executions were 'much better than the first round of executions in January' . The executions were necessary to fight drug crime in the country, he said . He dismissed Australia's withdrawal of its ambassador as a 'momentary reaction' to the executions   .
Rodrigo Gularte, 42, asked 'Am I being executed?' as he was being chained up to be transported to the jungle clearing on Nusakambangan island. Father Charlie Burrows said he talked to Gularte for an hour and a half late on Tuesday night to prepare him for the executions, but the convicted drug trafficker was confused.
Arshdeep Kaur, 14, and her mother Shinder, 38, were travelling from their home in Punjab to visit relatives. Group of about half a dozen men began harassing them on near-empty bus near Moga. Passengers and bus staff joined in sexual assault, and Arshdeep later died in hospital .

Danny Alexander released details of what he claimed are secret plans to cut Child Benefit and Child Tax Credits. The Prime Minister 'flatly rejected' the plans, claiming they were drawn up by civil servants. But the Lib Dems hit back, claiming Mr Cameron himself had asked officials to examine ways to curb access to benefits. Conservatives angrily denied the specific proposals set out in the document revealed by Mr Alexander. But they remain under pressure to spell out how they will make savings from the benefits bill. Vince Cable claims the Tories have a 'nasty streak' as he warns workers have been hit hard by the coalition he served in. Nick Clegg says the Tories could not be 'bothered' to come clean about their plans .

Ba Van Nguyen piloted a military helicopter to save his family during the fall of Saigon on April 30, 1975. He managed to fly a CH-47 Chinook, the largest helicopter in the South Vietnamese army, with his three young children and wife out of the city and into the South China Sea. The USS Kirk was not large enough to withstand the force of such a large helicopter, which would likely sink the ship and cause the death of everyone onboard. Nguyen then flew back out to sea and managed to pilot the helicopter alone, get out of his flight suit and jump into the water seconds before it crashed. Seconds later, he appeared in the water, wearing nothing but his boxer shorts and a shirt  .
Fourteen soldiers accused of abusing children as young as nine as they begged for something to eat. French president Francois Hollande said: 'If some soldiers have behaved badly, I will show no mercy' French defence ministry has vehemently denied covering up the scandal following revelations it was made aware of the allegations last year.
Crowds cheered as Pema Lama, 15, was pulled, dazed and dusty, from the rubble of a guesthouse in Kathmandu. He was carried out on a stretcher by medics who had placed an IV drip into his arm and a blue brace around his neck. His astonishing tale of survival came as a four-month-old baby was reunited with his mother after being rescued from their house. Mother Rasmila Awal thanked 'God and the rescuers' for saving the infant from death .
Five-month-old Sonit Awal was asleep upstairs in his family home when the quake struck. He was saved from death by a cupboard that fell on top of him protecting him from the rubble. Mother Rasmila Awal told MailOnline of her 'overwhelming joy' when rescuers finally arrived. The family are now homeless and living in a tarpulin opposite the wreckage.

But a vote-by-vote arrangement remains on the table .

Carl Thompson, 32, has put on 30 stone in just three years and is now bed-bound at 65 stone . He is too heavy to walk or wash himself and lives alone in a flat in Dover, Kent . Lives off a combination of benefits and a disability allowance and spends £200 a week on takeaways . After the death of his mother in 2012 he turned to food as a means of coping with his grief . Has been admitted to hospital for heart attacks and septicemia in the last three years   .

Research carried out by the Forsa Institute found the number of people who considered the end of the conflict a defeat fell to just nine per cent. The findings have been published exactly 70 years after Hitler committed suicide in Berlin.
Kevin Morgan, 55, was injured when a Land Rover Discovery reversed into his stationary Rover 75 in 2005. Married engineer suffered whiplash, which developed into chronic pain syndrome and deep depression. Claims he is in too much pain to leave his home and only rarely leaves his home. But he was seen out walking, joking with a builder and fixing a light on his car in a coffee shop with friend Max Clifford .
Chernobyl was the site of a devastating nuclear explosion 29 years ago on April 26, 1986. Since then the site has been closed off to the world, with scientists saying it won't be habitable for humans for 20,000 years. But Bionerd, a 'superhero' scientist, has visited the site six times to measure the high levels of radiation still lingering in the air.

Flux ropes are twisted bundles of magnetic field that extend out of and back into the surface of the sun. They are thought to be the main cause of several types of solar weather - including solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs) .
The fireball was captured on camera on Sunday by the United Kingdom Meteor Observing Network. Footage shows it glowing brightly as it races northwards towards the Irish Sea. Pieces from the meteorite could potentially be worth thousands of pounds, experts say. WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT.
Aud claims to have created the fuel of the future - diesel made from water and carbon dioxide. Experts used renewable energy to convert the carbon dioxide and water into a form of crude oil known as 'blue crude' The blue crude can then be refined in a similar way to standard crude oil to produce e-diesel. Tests have shown it can be mixed with diesel from fossil fuels, or used as a fuel in its own right. WARNING: GRAPHIC.
The technology is based on a technique known as 'neuromodulation' in which electricity stimulates the nervous system to restore sight. A surgeon first implants a small silicon chip with 150 electrodes on the retina. When the patient puts on the system's dark glasses, an integrated video camera sends images to computer.
Denim designer Bettina Liano is being pursued for almost $130,000 by the Australian Tax Office. The embattled jeans queen is the sister of Real Housewives of Melbourne star Gina Liano. She relaunched her eponymous label last year after going into liquidation in 2013 .
Laser expert Patrick Priebe created a working Iron Man-style arm and hand that fires beams from the back of the wrist or from the wearer's palm. In a video, the contraption is shown popping balloons and lighting matches from feet away. The gadget was created by Wuppertal-based Mr Prie be, who designs and builds metal laser gadgets to order online.

Photographer Jessica Fulford-Dobson took pictures of young girls skateboarding in Kabul, Afghanistan in 2012. Skateistan is a non-profit organization that aims to connect youth in Afghanistan with education through skateboarding. 40 per cent of the program's students are girls.
Copper inside the battery reached temperatures of at least 1,085°C (1,985°F) causing jets of molten material to burst from its vent. The footage is the first time the failure of Li-ion batteries due to overheating has been recorded. It was filmed by Paul Shearing from University College London and the findings are published in the journal Nature Communications. Researchers used thermal imaging and non-invasive high speed imaging techniques to observe changes in structure.
Nasa has been testing a flexible wing on a plane in California. The wing can bend from -2 degrees up to 30 degrees. It means that regular flaps aren't needed - and it is much lighter. It can also increase fuel efficiency and reduce noise on take-off and landing. The latest test of the technology took place above Nasa’s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California .
Indian doctors at Kathmandu’s Bir Hospital told Mail Today that packets of ‘beef masala’ were sent by Pakistan on Tuesday. The majority-Hindu country treats cows as sacred and there is a blanket ban on slaughter.
GCHQ unlawfully intercepted calls and emails from Sami al-Saadi, it has been ruled. The legally-privileged material was protected by strict rules. The Investigatory Powers Tribunal ordered spies to destroy two copies of the sensitive eavesdropped communications.
The Eshima Ohashi bridge in Japan is the third largest of its kind in the world. The road bridge spans a mile across Lake Nakaumi, linking the cities of Matsue and Sakaiminato. It's incredible slope has a gradient of 6.1%.

Scientists at Stanford University School of Medicine believe the lab-engineered antibodies could eradicate not only primary tumours, but also distant metastases that have spread through the body. The research has been hailed a 'tour de force', raising hopes the body's immune system could be trained to attack melanoma, pancreatic, breast and lung cancer. Process relies on same mechanism as organ transplants.

Scientists at Haverford College in Pennsylvania say they have spotted X-ray emissions consistent with thousands of white dwarfs. These are stars left behind after larger ones use up their fuel. They are thought to be leaving a 'mass grave' of white dwarf stars near the centre of the Milky Way.

Samsung sold 82.4m smartphones in the first three months of the year, for a 24.5 percent market share. Apple held an 18.2 percent share after selling 61.2 million iPhones. Samsung notably launched its flagship Galaxy S6 and S6 Edge phones at the end of the quarter in April. Apple iPhone sales dipped compared with the stronger holiday quarter. Figures were impacted by seasonal and other factors.
Some owners of the Apple Watch have found that it malfunctions if worn on tattooed wrists. Some dark, vibrant ink seems to cause the watch’s heart sensor to lose connection and give inaccurate readings. This is because the heart sensor reads a pulse by measuring light absorption though the skin. It is thought that red and green inks reflect light in a similar way and the sensor can't distinguish between them .
The Bruno Smartcan is said to be the first internet connected combined kitchen bin and vacuum cleaner. It uses sensors to detect when you want the lid to open or when dirt has been swept close so it can activate its integrated vacuum. It also has an integrated bag store and charging cord and sends alerts to a smartphone when it is low on bags.
Adidas has partnered with Spotify to create an app that tracks your speed and matches music to suit. Called Adidas go, the songs are selected based on the runner's musical interests and listening history. Songs are played in full but users can skip tracks.

All three planets in the system orbit the star, HD 7924, at a distance closer than Mercury orbits the sun. They complete their orbits in just 5, 15 and 24 days. Discovery shows the type of planetary system that astronomers expect to find around many nearby stars in the coming years.

The House Judiciary Committee on Thursday overwhelmingly passed the latest version of a bill known as the USA Freedom Act by a bipartisan vote of 25 to 2. The measure seeks to codify President Barack Obama's proposal to end the NSA's collection of domestic calling records. The authority to collect those records and other related surveillance provisions of the Patriot Act will expire June 1 unless Congress passes a law reauthorizing it, with changes .
All that’s unpleasant about male behaviour is ascribed to testosterone, yet as Joe Herbert explains, testosterone is at the heart of human life. It begins its influence in the womb as it helps to shape the distinctive characteristics of the male body. Testosterone also important for sexual behaviour in women before menopause.

Viafore, 46, was kayaking with her on the Hudson River April 19 when his vessel flipped over. He was not wearing a life jacket and was unable to turn the capsized boat right-side up. She called 911 telling the dispatcher she had fallen out of her own kayak and was picked up by a boater. Police have yet to find his body .

Thousands of commuters were stranded on trains for up to five hours after a power failure at Clapham Junction station. One train carrying more than 1,200 passengers between East Grinstead and Victoria was evacuated at 10am. Firefighters used a ladder to help passengers down before they were led along the track to safety. 321 trains were delayed for a total of more than 600 hours across the network. A planned strike by rail workers on Bank Holiday Monday has been called off.

Nasa has released an image taken by the probe's Visual and Infrared Spectrometer (Virs) It reveals distinct features such as volcanic vents and fresh craters. The spacecraft is expected to smash into the planet's surface on Thursday 30 April at 3:30pm Eastern Time (7.30pm GMT) .
Scientists from the University of Connecticut warned that one in six animals are at risk of extinction. They say animals are most at risk in South America, Australia, and New Zealand. If future temperatures increase by only two degrees compared to pre-industrial levels, the extinction risk would increase from 2.8 to 5.2%. But if global warming maintains its current trajectory and a 4.3 degree increase, that could increase to 16 per cent, the study warns .
When people try to search for the aubergine, or eggplant, emoji using a hashtag on the app, no posts appear. This is even though there are posts that have been tagged with it. It is believed to be because the emoji is commonly used to represent male genitalia. Instagram told MailOnline it is not commenting on the eggplant anomaly. But it is likely the app is restricting its use under guidelines.
Fossils from an extinct pygmy sperm whale that died seven million years ago have shed new light on the evolution of modern day whales. The remains, which were discovered in Panama, indicate that the organ involved in sound generation and echolocation got smaller throughout the whale’s evolution. In contrast modern sperm whales are much larger than their extinct relatives. The find will help experts fill in gaps in the Evolution of cetaceans.
Scientists say the experiment that what some people believe to be a ghostly presence is just a trick of the brain. By having signals mixed up in their brains, volunteers were made to feel that a creepy 'presence' was behind them. They counted up to four phantoms positioned where no-one was standing.

Pillars of Creation are located 7000 light-years away in the constellation of Serpens (The Serpent) They shed about 70 times the mass of the sun every million years or so. New observations reveal many new details about them.
Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin company has completed a successful spaceflight test in West Texas. The New Shepard vehicle rose to a height of 58 miles (94km) - four miles short of space - before landing. It was unmanned, but will ultimately take six people into space. The test took place from the company’s launch site in WestTexas. The booster failed to land successfully but the capsule landed without a hitch. Ultimately, the flights will enable six people to go to space. While in space, huge windows will give the customers a stunning view of Earth, and they'll also have several minutes of weightlessness.

They say the technology could one day be installed in cars to spot drink drivers and stop them starting the ignition. WARNING: GRAPHIC.

Bradford City's Valley Parade fire killed 56 fans and injured 265 on May 11, 1985. Author Martin Fletcher points the finger at the late Stafford Heginbotham, Bradford City's chairman at the time and a businessman who had been linked to eight previous blazes. Fletcher spent 15 years researching the fire in which four members of his family died in the disaster .

Researchers at the University of Washington studied the telerobot Raven II. They found that robots designed for surgery could be 'easily' hacked in to. This is because they are operated over public networks. This allowed the researchers to access them and stop them working. They were able to change the speed of the arms of the robot and change their orientation. And they were also able to ‘easily stop the robot from ever being properly reset’.

Elon Musk has unveiled a $3,000 (£1,980) battery that can run an entire home for eight hours. Powerwall is three feet wide and four feet tall, weighs 220lbs, and can be installed on an outside or inside wall. It powers up overnight when electricity rates are cheaper. Users can then switch battery on during the day.
Curtin University geologist Dr Zheng-Xiang Li travelled to Nepal to study how the Indian and Eurasian plates are moving together. The Indian plate is continuing to move North at a few centimetres per year - causing tectonic activity. But other continents are also moving towards each other, causing tremors and devastating earthquakes. In 50 to 200 million years they are expected to form a new supercontinent called Amasia, which may be centered on the North Pole.
Researchers studied stone tools used by people in the Early Ahmarian culture and the Protoaurignacian culture, living in south and west Europe and west Asia around 40,000 years ago. They found human tools were no more effective than Neanderthal-created tools of the same era. Discovery means we may need to rethink the reasons humans survived Neanderthals.

Researchers at Yahoo Labs in California have created a sensor that can recognise the shape of your ear or any other body part you want to use to access your device. Called Bodyprint, the technology turns a standard touchscreen into a biometric scanner. To accept an incoming call, users would only need to press their ear against the phone. During tests with 12 participants, Bodyprint classified body parts with 99.98 per cent accuracy and identified users with 99% accuracy.
The Salt card is designed to end the tiresome task of manually unlocking a smartphone or tablet by automatically unlocking it whenever the user is nearby. The credit card-sized gadget also locks devices again as soon as a user moves out of range at a distance of 10ft (three metres) It connects to an app on a user’s Android handset or iPhone via Bluetooth and also tells them if they have strayed too far from their wallet, where it is suggested the card is stored.

Bombardier beetles secrete foul-smelling or bad-tasting chemicals from their abdomens to ward off predators. When threatened, they combine chemicals in an explosive chamber in their abdomen to heat and propel their defensive load. This behaviour has been caught on camera by researchers at the University of Arizona.

Bon Apetit have revealed that the best way to revive a stale loaf of bread is to run it under water. The water turns to steam, which rehydrates the bread’s crumb, or interior, while the heat of the oven firms up the crust.
Most searched for term globally is HIV and AIDS, followed by herpes and then Human Papilloma Virus (HPV) Chlamydia and gential warts attracted the most searches in the UK in the past year, while in the US herpes was the most searched for. Boliva’s Cal Orcko paleontological site is the result of tectonic activity that forced earth upwards. It comprises 462 trails made up of 5,055 prints and frequent landslides reveal new ones. Some of them are more than a metre in length, indicating the size of some of the vast beasts that roamed the area in the upper cretaceous period - a time in which the majority of dinosaurs lived. Some belong to unknown species.
US researchers claim that exact prices of goods on eBay attract higher offers than round numbers. Sellers who end their price with ‘00’ typically receive offers that are five to eight per cent lower than those with more specific prices. When the initial price is a round number, such as $1,000, the average counteroffer is between five and eight% lower than if it is a non-round number .

Palaeontologists in China say the impeccably preserved fossil belongs to a small dinosaur thought to have lived 160 million years ago. The strange-looking creature had small stiff feathers on its body and long finger-like bones extending from each wrist that were covered in a membrane like a bat’s wing. The dinosaur may have been able to glide and even flap .

Jaysh Al-Islam - or Army of Islam - is a militant group that opposes ISIS and the Syrian regime. It was formed in 2011 when up to 60 rebel factions in Syria merged to fight the regime. Its graduation ceremony for trainee soldiers was held in the Ghouta suburb of Damascus. It included a fleet of armoured tanks and 1,700 soldiers in what it calls the 'largest military parade witnessed' .

Three Russian ships spent the winter docked inside the mountain hideaway deep inside the country's mountainous terrain. Starbucks ran its European division through the Netherlands where it paid almost no tax on its profits. Dutch division paid just £1.9million of tax, despite reporting profits of £300million. Starbucks could face millions of pounds in back taxes.

Good was speeding and was driving at 54 mph in a 35 mph zone at 11:21 p.m. on a dark county road.
Drinking excessive amounts of alcohol when young can damage the brain and cause permanent changes to DNA. This can put teenagers at risk of anxiety disorders and alcoholism. Alcohol changes genes in brain cells, which stop the cells developing connections between them. However, researchers discovered a cancer drug may be able to reverse the damage .
Astronomers have used a telescope in New Mexico to watch a star take shape over eight years. The star – known as W75N(B)-VLA2 – is 300 times brighter and eight times bigger than our sun. The images were taken 18 years apart from 1996 and 2014.

Påhoj was designed by Swedish designer Lycke Mr von Schantz. It has a 'lightweight chassis' and is 3.2ft (1 metre) tall. It clips onto the back of a standard bike using a specially-designed attachment. A child is then strapped into the seat in an almost vertical position. The parent cycles to their destination, and once they arrive, can unclip the seat and push it like a buggy.

Pelvic organ prolapse occurs when tissue supporting the pelvic organs - including the womb - becomes weak. Many women are offered just one solution: a hysterectomy, which ends fertility. But a sacrohysteropexy is a half-hour keyhole procedure.

A researcher says a 'bone flute' found in Slovenia is not an instrument - instead, he says it is simply a bone chewed by a hyena with teeth marks. The research suggests historians have been fooled by 'instruments' attributed to Neanderthals. Dr Cajus Diedrich from the Paleo-Logic Independent Institute of Geosciences says they are chew toys of animals.
Shinto Kanamara Matsuri, the Festival of the Steel Phallus, is held every spring at the phallus-shaped Kanayama Shrine. Participants pray to a god who is said to help with fertility, child birth and protection from sexually transmitted infections.
'Marilyn Einstein' was created by superimposing a blurry picture of Marilyn Monroe over a picture of Albert Einstein. Features with a high spatial frequency (Einstein) are only visible when you're viewing them close up, and those with low spatial frequencies (Monroe)

Researchers from London and Edinburgh have developed a computer that can collate meteorological information and then produce forecasts as if they were written by a human. It uses a process known as 'natural language generation' (NLG) These computer-generated weather updates are being tested by scientists at Heriot-Watt University and University College London. If the project is successful a prototype system will be tested .

Genes for Good is a Facebook app designed to survey the health of millions of social network users. Users can also send in spit samples to tie their survey results to their genes. It was set up by biostatisticians from the University of Michigan and is available over 18s in the US. Each member who submits a spit sample will also see a copy of their results, which include their genetic ancestry as well as genetic data.

He was found sitting on the capsized hull of his sailboat, Angel, which had lost its mast and was approximately 200 miles east of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina. A Coast Guard helicopter crew from North Carolina flew to the ship and airlifted Jordan to a hospital in Norfolk, Virginia. He survived his ordeal by drinking rain water and eating raw fish and flour fried in oil while stranded at sea .

Anthony Shaffer said on Fox News' The O'Reilly Factor on Monday night that Bowe Bergdahl 'had Afghan contacts and he was actually trying to offer himself up with the Taliban' The former military intelligence officer said he had been told the information by two senior sources who knew about a 2009 Naval Criminal Investigative Service investigation. The EU has been investigating the US search engine for five years following complaints that it abuses its dominance in the continent. If found to have been behaving unfairly, Google could be fined ten per cent of its annual revenues, which would be more than £4billion .
A total lunar eclipse will transform the moon on Saturday night and will be visible in the skies of North America, Asia and Australia. It is the third in a series of four blood moons, with the final one expected on September 28. Pastor John Hagee said the sight suggests a world-changing event will take place, as predicted in the Bible. Nasa says the change in hue is entirely harmless .
The Borden family burial monument at Oak Grove Cemetery in Fall River, Massachusetts was defaced with black and green paint. The vandalism was discovered on Monday, the day after a Lifetime miniseries, The Lizzie Borden Chronicles, premiered. Borden went on trial for brutally murdering her father and stepmother with a hatchet in 1892.

Dr Milton Wainwright has been trying to convince academics that he has found aliens in Earth's stratosphere for several years. Now he claims he has new evidence of 'extra-terrestrial organisms' floating 25 miles (40km) above the planet. He says the organisms test positive for DNA, and have masses that are 'six times bigger than the size limit of a particle which can be elevated from Earth to this height'
