Little Foot, an important fossil of an early human forerunner unearthed in the 1990s in South Africa, is roughly 3.7 million years old. Findings may have important evolutionary implications.
Archaeologists from Cambridge University and Oxford Brookes University studied genetic, fossil and archaeological evidence. They found evidence that suggests Neanderthals would have been infected by diseases such as tuberculosis, typhoid, whooping cough, encephalitis and the common cold. They speculate pathogens like Heliocbacter pylori, the bacteria that causes stomach ulcers, were brought to Europe by modern humans.

Doctors warned her to keep the baby or she risked the tumour turning malignant. She decided to carry on with the pregnancy and give birth to her son Noah. Seven weeks after Noah was born she had brain surgery.

Employers added just 126,000 jobs in March, the fewest since December 2013 – snapping a 12-month streak of gains above 200,000. The unemployment rate remained at 5.5 percent, the Labor Department said in its monthly report Friday. The March jobs data raised uncertainties about the world's largest economy, which for months has been the envy of other industrialized nations for its steadily robust hiring and growth. Employers now appear wary about the economy, especially as a strong dollar has slowed U.S. exports.

Three former managers of the AIDS Healthcare Foundation filed a suit last week alleging the company paid employees and patients kickbacks for patient referrals in an effort to boost funding from federal health programs. The lawsuit alleges kickbacks started in 2010 at the company's California headquarters and spread to programs in Florida and several other locations. The Los Angeles-based company cares for more than 400,000 patients in 36 countries and is leading a mass testing initiative to identify and treat an estimated 25 million people who don't know they are infected.

California has been in a drought for four years. Scientists at the University of Connecticut say we know how far away the source of a sound is by listening to the echoes it produces. In a study they found that the reverberation of sound helps us locate the distance of, for example, a car passing round a bend. They said echoes and fluctuations in volume are the cues we use to figure out the distance between us and the source.

Radar images from Europe's Sentinel-1a satellite have revealed the aftermath of the Nepal earthquake in unrivalled detail. The information from the satellites has been transformed into an interferogram, which provides a colourful and highly detailed view of the Earth's land mass. By comparing before and after images, scientists have discovered Mount Everest shrank by about one inch. The tallest point in the world, however, still stands at 29,029 feet. An area 75 miles (120km) by 30 miles (50km) has lifted up around Kathmandu.

Examination of 23,500 mammoth bones found them riddled with osteoporosis and lacking in calcium. Major mineral deficiency resulted in them breaking their limbs and spines, leaving them unable to walk. In turn it meant the giant animal, which stood 10ft high, collapsed to the ground and could not forage.

Church of England’s ambitious plans involve harnessing the energy of Bath's 45°C spring water to power a modern heating system for the building. Engineers plan to excavate ancient crypts below the church to tap into a Roman drain where 850,000 litres of natural spring water empties every day. They hope to divert the warm water instead through a network of underground pipes to provide a world-first natural underfloor heating system. The Abbey was granted planning permission for the unique £18million scheme two years ago.

He wrote that Russia should develop a small force of megaweapons that can cause tsunamis and eruptions in the US . Researchers at Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology Graduate University (OIST) in Japan compared fairy circles to skin cells. Found in Namibia, they are large barren patches of earth measuring anywhere between 10ft and 65ft in diameter. They are ringed by short grass dotting the scrub land like craters on the moon, or big freckles. German researchers analysed the spatial distribution of the fairy circles and found that they are ‘remarkably regular'

Lusitanian toadfish lives in rocky crevices in the Mediterranean Sea and Atlantic Ocean. Males build nests under rocks during mating season, which runs from May to July. They sing to attract females and warn off rivals who may be trying to swipe their nesting site. The whistles vary according to the size of the fish and their size.

Gibbons produce soft 'hoo' calls that are almost inaudible to the human ear. Yet scientists have found the animals use these whispers to communicate specific information to each other. Researchers at the University of Durham used computer algorithms to analyse the whoops and songs produced by the apes. They found the quiet calls were designed to alert other gibbons nearby .

Police responding to a missing persons report found their bodies Monday after friends, school workers and Todd's supervisor at work had knocked on the door.

TheThe lawsuit, which has 750 plantiffs and includes victims and their families, is seeking $1billion, claiming that Johns Hopkins University approved and helped to plan the study. It ran from 1945 to 1956, and the few victims who are still alive were almost all children when they were unknowingly infected, and many of them were orphans. It is estimated approximately 700 people were infected with the disease, and of the roughly 75% who were treated, only 25% were reported to have completed their treatment. The United States government only admitted to this experiment in 2010, which was run by Dr. John Cutler, also known for his infamous syphilis experiment in Tuskegee, Alabama. The study resulted in 83million dollars in benefits and 83million benefits over a lifetime.

The experiment is being run by researchers at the Japanese space agency (Jaxa) Called the Plant Gravity Sensing study, it will be conducted when new supplies are taken to the ISS by a SpaceX Dragon capsule on 13 April. The experiment will examine the cellular process of formation in thale cress, a small flowering plant related to cabbage. Results will show if the plants can sense changes in gravity, and adapt levels of calcium in their cells to compensate.

The Red Lady's remains were found in the El Mirón Cave in Cantabria, Spain. Radiocarbon dating suggests she was buried 18,700 years ago. Her grave provides the first evidence of an ancient Magdalenian burial in the region. An engraved stone found near her remains appears to have been a makeshift tombstone.

Federal government regulations and the American Heart Association have for decades warned that excess salt contributes to the deaths of tens of thousands of Americans each year. As the federal government prepares its influential Dietary Guidelines for 2015, some scientists are now saying that the average American salt consumption rate carries no risk. The guidelines currently dictate the people should limit their intake to 2,300 milligrams, with an even stricter 1,500 milligram limit for African Americans and people over 50. In February the Dietary Guidelines Advisory Committee recommended keeping the larger limit.

Fergus Simpson from the University of Barcelona applied a mathematical formula to assume aliens obey the same laws of conservation of energy as animals on Earth. And from this, he calculates that if intelligent extraterrestrials exist they will typically weigh 650lbs (300kg) - around the size of a polar bear. But the calculations don’t take into account an alien planet’s surface gravity, which means the calculation is incomplete.

The Caverne du Pont-d'Arc Cave has been built a few miles from the original site in Vallon-Pont-D'arc in Southern France. It contains 1,000 painstakingly-reproduced drawings of 425 animals as well as 450 bones and other features. Experts scanned the original drawings using 3D modelling techniques to capture each marking and position them correctly on the bumpy replica walls to the millimetres. While the real cave is 91,490 square feet (8,500 metres) the replica is 32,290 square feet. (3,000 square metres) in area in area .

High Court threw out rules introduced to stop violent prisoners being transferred out of high-security jails. Policy brought in after fugitive armed robber Michael Wheatley walked out of open jail in May. Wheatley had previously been handed 13 life sentences at the Old Bailey in 2002.
Bloomberg, 73, has been elected to the top Big Apple job three times in a row. He has significant business interests in London and owns a $30million mansion in the city. Has said he thinks of London as his 'second home' and has backing of Conservative Party officials.
Sickly sweet dessert is on sale at The Wicked Waffle in North End, Portsmouth, for £25. Customers who can clear their plate within 45 minutes, with no toilet breaks, are awarded the meal for free and a winners' T-shirt.
Nearly 3,400 miles were covered with 99 percent of the drive in fully automated mode. Team collected nearly three terabytes of data, about 30 percent of all of the printed material in the Library of Congress in the US .

A court heard he also emailed the woman a link to an online sex video she was in - and threatened to post it on her Facebook page. He knew his victim from childhood and knew she had been previously involved in making sex tapes. He was jailed for 12 weeks and banned from contacting her.
Kathleen Blomberg, a resident at the heavily damaged 125 Second Ave., which is still under a full-vacate order, has been reunited with her two cats, Kitty Cordelia and Sebastian. The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals found the traumatized animals under her bed and said it took about an hour to coax them out. Two people died and 22 were injured in last week's explosion.

Remington 'Remi' Walden, four, was killed three years ago when his family's Jeep Grand Cherokee exploded when it was rear-ended. Jurors in Decatur County, Georgia ruled on Thursday that the SUV manufacturer, Chrysler, acted with reckless disregard for human life in selling the family a 1999 Jeep with a gas tank mounted behind the rear axle. The tanks have little structure to protect them if struck from behind, making them susceptible.
Cheryl Howe, 32, was diagnosed with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) at the age of 12. Suffers from excessive hair growth on her face, breasts, stomach and legs. Has been fighting for six years for treatment on the NHS, spending £2,000 a year on raz.
Edward Nudel, 41, of Staten Island broke into his relative's home on March 11 and strangled a 2-year-old Pomeranian named Lola 'in an especially depraved and sadistic manner' Police were called and arrived to find him sleeping in his bed with Lola lying motionless on the floor nearby with her tongue out.
Dr Joe Hanson has calculated what the human body is in terms of chemical elements. A 'human molecule' might contain 375 million atoms of hydrogen, 132 million of oxygen and 85 million of carbon. By comparison, this human molecule contains just one atom of cobalt and three molecules of the metal molybdenum. according to Dr Hanson.
Theresa May said police will have to record Islamophobic attacks as a separate category. It will create the first accurate picture of the extent of Islamophobic hate crimes in Britain. The Home Office does not publish national statistics for Islamophobic offences  .

It was originally thought Reclaim Australia had handed over the reigns to one of their supporters to control their feed. However, 'Jeremy' began to tweet a number of joke comments shortly after Sydney protest got underway. Organisers behind the Sydney protest were quick to disassociate themselves with the account, saying 'It's not us'

He is suing CBS, Duane Tollison and Albert Colley for violation of labor laws, infliction of emotional distress and discrimination. Lombardi says he was forced to quit his job in November and relocate to Los Angeles after two alleged sexual harassment incidents involving two separate male bosses. The first alleged encounter occurred at a CBS Christmas party in December 2013 and the other in May 2014. He says he reported both incidents to HR, but that they went 'nowhere'

He toasted his brother Adrian and his new wife Sarah at their March 29 wedding in Melbourne using his voice. The unique speech performed by Daniel at Poet's Lane in Sherbrooke has been viewed over 100,000.
The Southern Poverty Law Center in February filed a lawsuit against Georgia Department of Corrections officials on behalf of Ashley Diamond, a transgender woman. The lawsuit says prison officials have failed to provide adequate treatment for Diamond's gender dysphoria, a condition that causes extreme distress.

Robson was once the singer's staunchest defender, but now claims Jackson was a predator who repeatedly sexually abused him as a child. He now says he 'lived in silence and denial for 22 years' and alleges he was seven years old when Jackson first molested him. The estate has previously asked the court to reject the claims on the basis that Robson waited too long to file and because Jackson is the only other person with knowledge about the accusations and has been dead for more than five years.

He was in Yemen visiting his pregnant wife and the couple's two-and-a-half-year-old daughter when he was killed in a mortar attack on Tuesday. He wanted to take his family to Oakland, but the US has withdrawn its diplomatic staff and the country has shut down most airports. The equipment was found purely by chance in April last year after a fire at a block of flats in Edinburgh. Police and army Explosive Ordnance Device experts were called in to test the substances. The former Syrian doctor pleaded guilty to a breach of the 1883 Explosive Substances Act.

Discovery could be worth billions of pounds and increase fears of renewed conflict. Argentina invaded the islands in 1982, leading to conflict that cost 260 lives.

Ile Louët is perched in the midst of Morlaix Bay in Brittany, France, and is the perfect secluded retreat for explorers. The lighthouse was used manually from 1857 to the 1960s and was inhabited by the families of the lighthouse keepers until 2004  .

He was rushed to Grady Memorial Hospital with gunshot wound to the back of his head. He remained in intensive care for two days, but died Monday.

The strange formation was photographed by amateur astronomer Gordon Ewen in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. The phenomenon is fairly common and the number of spots on the solar surface reflects with how active the sun is. They occur when a concentration of magnetic fields causes the surface temperature to reduce, making a specific section of the sun stand out from its surroundings.

The Sokaze-ki Q fan uses fluid dynamics to take air in at the rear of the 10-inch (25cm) device. It is then moved using so-called impellers through specially designed channels before blasting it from the front via a turbofan. Alternatively, the Q has a '1/f fluctuation' function that sends 'natural, fluctuating wind' that mimics breeze.

They are virtually identical in every way, boasting an indoor swimming pool, four storeys and stunning sea views. Eva Mozes Kor, 81, publicly embraced Groening last week in an extraordinary act of forgiveness.

Former lecturer Martyn Reuby won the first round in his legal battle against Unite, after a tribunal ruled that he had been employed to teach its courses. The employment tribunal ruling is a major embarrassment to the union, which has led the campaign against the use of zero-hours contracts. It is also a blow to Ed Miliband, who has received more than £13million from Unite since becoming leader in 2010. Labour was facing further embarrassment over the issue last night after Parliament's expenses watchdog confirmed some of the party’s MPs were employing staff on a zero-hour basis. Some 68 Labour MPs have used zero- hours contracts in the past two years, including Shadow Chancellor Ed Balls, shadow health secretary Andy Burnham and Mr Miliband's parliamentary aide Karen Buckham   .

The crash in Redford, Detroit, flipped her vehicle and killed her on October 6 last year. Her death caused outrage when it was revealed he had been paroled five months earlier. He was sentenced to 20-45 years in prison this week.
Lunar eclipse this month will appear in Sydney's north-eastern sky on Easter Saturday. The eclipse is the third in a series of four blood moons, with the final one expected on September 28. The partial eclipse is set to start at about 8.15pm in Cairns. Adelaide will be have the clearest skies out of all the states - where the partial eclipse begins at 8.45pm.

He faces 12 to 24 years in prison when sentencing resumes Thursday . He also faces a wrongful death lawsuit filed by Amanda Murphy's estate.

Bacall, one of Hollywood's great golden age actresses, died in August aged 89 in her nine-room home overlooking New York's Central Park, which is currently on the market for $26 million. The actress bought the sprawling Manhattan home for just $48,000 in 1961 and lived there with her three children for the rest of her life. Among the most valuable items purchased during the auction were a hand-colored etching by naturalist John James Audubon American White Pelican, which fetched an impressive $173,000, three times more than was expected, Bonhams New York said .

The lunar event - where Earth's shadow completely blocks the moon - lasted only five minutes, making it the shortest eclipse of the century. The so-called 'blood moon' could be seen by billions of people across the western U.S., Canada, Australia and New Zealand. It is the third in a series of four blood moons, with the final one expected on September 28 .

Photographer Victor Albert Prout travelled along the River Thames in a makeshift boat to capture the images. He developed the negatives in an improvised dark room on board his punt, which he sailed along the river. The collection is the oldest documented record of Britain's best known landmarks, such as Windsor Castle and the Houses of Parliament, dating back 150 years.

Ephedra foeminea waits for the full moon to bloom and produces a sugary droplet of sugary fluid to attract pollinating insects. Researchers from Stockholm University noticed the droplets at the same time of the year having conducted four years of research. It's unknown how the plant ‘knows’ when it’s full moon, but they can detect different intensities of light during the phases of the moon as well as gravity.

The property was originally built in the 1870s as the servant's quarters to a Victorian villa next door and was last bought by his partner Catherine Barber in 1989 for $130,000. It was first put on the market in March but failed to sell in an initial auction in mid-March, but sold on Wednesday  .
Managers from the London Ambulance Service have just filled 225 vacant posts with applicants from Sydney and Melbourne. They were recruited on the back of a series of practical demonstrations on dummies, a written exam and an interview that lasted in all between four and six hours. Each trip to Australia costs the ambulance service £90,000 in flights and hotel bills, but they return having hired on average 200 paramedics. The ambulance service is also severely understaffed and, across England, around 1,250 posts are unfilled – a tenth of what is needed. Hospital managers have been flying out to Spain and Portugal to hire batches of 30 nurses at a time. The NHS is recruiting overseas because it has failed to train enough staff in Britain to meet the needs of the rising and ageing population .

Tampons absorb chemicals commonly used on toilet paper, laundry detergents and shampoos. They glow under UV light, meaning they could shed light on previously undetectable misplumbed pathways. It’s estimated that around five per cent of homes in the UK have pipes that are misconnected, causing them to leak sewage. By using this technique at the opening of different pipes, they can trace the source of the sewage to certain households.

28 fossilised cone snail shells found in the northern Dominican Republic are up to 6.6 million years old. They were covered in streaks of orange, purple, blue and even large pokadots. Scientists believe the shells include 13 entirely new species.

'Marine photic zone euxinia' took place in one of the prehistoric oceans. This happens when the sun-lit surface waters of the ocean become devoid of oxygen and are poisoned by hydrogen sulphide. The study authors fear that the planet today could suffer similar consequences. The same CO2 rise that led to the oxygen-depleted oceans also led to extinction.
Alexander Bradley appeared in Bristol County Superior Court on Wednesday for Justice Susan Garsh to decide what he could testify to in front of a jury in the Aaron Hernandez murder trial. He will be allowed to testify that Hernandez had access to the type of pistol he is accused of using to murder semipro football player Odin Lloyd. But not about a separate 2013 incident in which Bradley contends Hernandez shot him in the face. Bradley, who says he was Hernandez's former drug dealer and then his best friend, cannot reveal his claim that Hernandez shot he in the eye. The judge blocked Bradley from testifying that Hernandez was 'unreasonably suspicious' and would not allow Bradley to use iPhones around him during his testimony .

Researchers at Joint Base Lewis-McChord in Tacoma, Washington, concluded that military suicides may be more likely after members leave the service than during active duty deployment. Suicide rates were similar regardless of whether or not servicemen and women were deployed to Iraq or Afghanistan. Leaving the military significantly increased suicide risk, with a suicide rate of 26.06 after separating from service compared with 15.12 for those who remained in uniform. The study is the largest of its kind.

The native Australian marsupial once occupied more than 70 per cent of the Australian mainland. Now it’s disappeared from around 80 per cent with small populations remaining in Queensland, the Northern Territory and Western Australia. Calfornia Gov. Jerry Brown ordered a 25 percent overall cutback in water use by cities and towns in the golden state on Wednesday. The crackdown comes as California and its nearly 40 million residents move toward a fourth summer of drought with no relief in sight. State reservoirs have a year's worth of water, and with record low snowfall over the winter there won't be much to replenish them. Wells in some parts of the state are going dry as groundwater levels fall. The state government is also ramping up a water conservation campaign that will include billboards and radio messages through the end of June.

Greenstone acts like a beacon, or booster, to help messages move around so-called wireless mesh networks. It takes advantage of a feature that launched in Apple’s iOS 7 called Multipeer Connectivity Framework. This creates a network in which phones become nodes, and data is passed between nodes. Messages are sent securely, so individual nodes can’t read them and can be sent anonymously to avoid snoop.

Scientists believe the first complex conversation between humans gradually took place around 50,000 to 100,000 years ago. Much of it, they believe, still involved cavemen grunting, or hunter-gatherers mumbling and pointing. Professor Shigeru Miyagawa, of Massachusetts Institute of Technology, argues that language developed rapidly with people quickly using complex sentences that sound like ours.

A University of Nebraska researcher has revealed why stress is bad for you in a video. Limited periods of stress are good, as they release the hormone cortisol. This is useful in helping you recover from very tense situations. But too much will lower your immune system and make your bones fragile. The science of stress was explained in the video by Dr Raychelle Burks. In it she reveals why prolonged periods ofstress - due to money and work - can inhibit the immune system.

And also, you like women' She also claims that Diller 'worships' his wife Diane von Fürstenberg, who she says he 'hated for some reason' Barbara Walters lost interest in her when her newspaper column at the New York Post was cut, but still considers her a friend, she says.
Kyle Patrick Loughlin, who was enrolled at Bridgewater State University on an early childhood education course, was arrested on Tuesday night after reportedly admitting that he'd molested two boys aged between four and five. Police then proceeded to search his dorm room where they found more than 100 pairs of children's underwear and diapers. The student allegedly said that he started feeling an attraction to young boys as a teenager and he sometimes wrote 'sexually charged fantasy stories' involving children. Authorities later removed a computer and other evidence from the suspect's family home. He will now be held without bail until a dangerousness hearing next week.
Dalny Vostok was carrying 132 crew members when it sank in Sea of Okhotsk at 4am on Thursday. At least 54 bodies have been recovered from the freezing sea and 13 people are still missing. Rescue operation involving more than 1,300 fishermen and emergency staff is underway. Temperatures in the water can dip to as low as -2 degrees celsius.

In extreme cases, she says, it may even lead to macular degeneration, which causes dark patches in the field of vision. Children and the elderly are most at risk on account of their delicate eyes and delicate eyes.

Sydney’s dwelling values rose by 5.8 per cent in the last quarter bringing the average median house price to $690,000. It's the strongest increase since April in 2009, according to the latest figures from RP Data. The money was collected from students at the University of Surrey. It was then submerged in agar - a substance that allows bacteria to grow quickly - and monitored for three to four days. The students found thousands of bacteria colonies living on their money. Most of the bacteria was harmless, but money has been known to carry dangerous diseases. One ten pound note yielded Bacillus mycoides, which is common in soil, suggesting someone was gardening before handling cash.

'I always felt he needed to jack up his stories... he was trying so hard to overcome his insecurities,' one executive told the publication, according to the report.

The Vasimr engine is being developed by the Ad Astra Rocket company in Texas. It uses plasma, an electrically charged gas that can be heated to extreme temperatures by radio waves and controlled and guided by strong magnetic fields. The next window is open from January 2016 to April 2016, and will see the launch of two more missions to the red planet. Nasa will give the company about £6.8 million ($10 million) to get the engine almost ready to fly .

Esa’s Rosetta spacecraft has survived a hair-raising encounter with comet 67P after the probe ran into difficulties during a recent flyby. On Saturday the spacecraft had dipped to within nine miles (14km) of the surface to take a closer look at the jets that are being ejected from its surface. But during the manoeuvre, Rosetta lost sense of where it was due to the amount of dust and gas and was placed into ‘safe mode’ .

Researchers based at different institutions in Tokyo, noted that rats flatten their ears, narrow their eyes and puff up their cheeks when they are in pain. They found that Long-Evans rats can read pain on other animal’s faces and use the information to make decisions. They may even use expressions to warn other rats of danger or ask for help.

Discovery in an Austrian cellar shocked scientists in a country where cows dominate the rural landscape. Genetic analysis of the beast show it was a Bactrian-dromedary hybrid – a breed popular in the Ottoman army at the time. It may have been left in the town of Tulln for trading after the siege of Vienna in 1683.
U.S. District Court Judge Jon Tigar in San Francisco ruled that denying sex reassignment surgery to 51-year-old Michelle-Lael Norsworthy violates her constitutional rights. She has been in prison since 1987, serving a life sentence for second-degree murder. The surgery could cost taxpayers as much as $100,000. The ruling says it would be the second time nationwide that such a surgery has been performed on an inmate, an apparent reference to a Texas inmate .

Researchers from Texas A&M School of Public Health found that hospitalizations from car crashes dropped 7 percent between 2003 and 20010 in the 45 states with texting bans when compared to states with no restrictions. Arizona, Texas, Montana, Missouri, and Oklahoma are the only five states in America that do not have texting at the wheel bans. Older drivers are more likely to make texting and driving mistakes.

Professor Bryan Sykes of the University of Oxford claims a towering woman named Zana lived in 19th Century Russia. Witnesses described the six-foot, six-inches tall woman as having 'all the characteristics of a wild animal' . She was found lurking in the Caucasus mountains between Georgia and Russia in the 1850s. Sykes analysed the DNA of her living relatives and found west-African genes. DNA evidence from Zana's granddaughter and the remains of her son Khwit also proved she was African  .

The four-poster oak wood bed was dumped in the car park of Redland House Hotel in Chester in 2010. It was later sold at auction for £2,200 by a four- poster bed specialist from Northumberland who spotted it on the internet. TV historian Jonathan Foyle has spent years trying to prove it is the only surviving Tudor bed. DNA testing on the bed's timber proved it once belonged to King Henry VII .

The Cheyenne Mountain Complex in Colorado was built in the 1960s to protect the North American Aerospace Command (NORAD) and US Northern Command from a Soviet nuclear attack. It is home to 15 three-story buildings protected from nuclear blasts and seismic movement by a system of 1,000 giant springs. The complex is designed to withstand a direct hit by a 30 megaton nuclear explosion and has 25-ton blast doors surrounding the complex.

Genetic analysis shows that hunter gatherers living in Spain up to 8,500 years ago still had dark skin. It was not until 7,800 years ago, when the first farmers migrated from the Near East through Turkey, that two key genes that provide lighter skin appeared. that European's skin colour began to lighten.

The United States' National Defense Reserve Fleet was set up after the Second World War in 1945. At its peak in the 1950s, the fleet consisted of nearly 2,280 ships moored across the U.S. But as the need for the fleet has diminished, so has the number of vessels . Today, just over 120 ships remain, posing a risk to the environment in the bays where they are moored, polluting the waters .

It details a method of scanning a user's face using the front-facing camera each time the phone is moved into a certain position. Research led by the University of Montana has found that eating fast food after a workout may be just as beneficial as dietary supplements. Researchers found that during recovery periods between periods of exercise, it didn’t matter what food was eaten. Performance remained the same after resting for several hours. Levels of glycogen - used by muscles as ‘fuel’ - were actually slightly higher after fast food as a recovery food.

Fossils of a creature bearing a 'striking' similarity to depictions of Nessie have been found in a 19th century collection. Originally belonging to Cromarty writer and geologist, Hugh Miller, the specimens now sit in Inverness Museum and Art Gallery. Fossils belong to a species known as Pterichthyoides milleri - or 'Pessie' as it has been christened.

Scientists at the University of Illinois recruited 150 children aged between seven and 10 and gave them a game which involved learning a pattern between a set of shapes and colours. The game was designed to test cognitive flexibility, which is our ability to shift attention, select information and alter our response strategy to fit the changing demands of a task. Children who ate the fatty diet performed worse when they were given the game.

To counteract even the slightest shifts in gravitational pull, engineers build the jet on 'floating' concrete rafts. These rafts measure 59ft (18 metres) and 9.8ft (3 metres)

Cheng Chen, 27, was inspired to make the iconic body armour after watching the film with his younger brother. He spent six months painstakingly researching and building the replica to the movie's exact measurements. The finished product is two metres high, weighs just 4kg and comes with helmet, gloves and backpack. But Cheng said he was too chubby to fit into it.
The Sainsbury's app is in development and will be trialled at a store in Wandsworth later this year. As customers scan their household items, a live pricing tool will show their list with current store prices. Prices will update automatically if an item goes on sale, or becomes part of a multi-buy deal for example. A receipt is generated automatically .

Until now doctors have assumed that babies' brains are not developed enough to feel pain. It means that newborns often go without painkillers, even during invasive procedures. But new research from Oxford University shows babies feel pain, and their pain thresholds are lower than adults. Findings overturns medical consensus that babies have high threshold.

He is being held without bail in the mental ward of a New Orleans state prison. Prosecutors have asked a U.S. magistrate judge to order Durst to federal court.

They claim the stone is between 300 and 320 million years old and after X-raying it, believe there is another hidden 'screw' inside the stone. The screw-like shape may actually be the reversed-shape of the creature, which gradually dissolved while the rock formed around it. Experts have not said what the screw is made of  .

Comfortably Numb is a new, single-use device that eases the pain of an injection by producing a rapid chemical reaction to cool the patient's skin. It is 3D printed and consists of two sealed chambers containing the chemical ammonium nitrate and water. Within 60 seconds the skin is numb  .

Bruce Rauner has proposed eliminating the state Historic Preservation Agency that manages sites including the tomb as it currently exists. What's more, the popular tourist site was pilloried in this month's issue of National Geographic magazine as having 'all the historical character of an office lobby' The hours and days the Lincoln tomb is open have been reduced, and it's staffed with fewer employees since state lawmakers last year cut $1.1 million funding for sites in the Springfield area .

Damon Muller has almost doubled in size due to swelling and bloating since he was diagnosed with Juvenile Dermatomyositis (JDM) in November. The rare autoimmune disease can only be treated with high doses of steroids and a chemotherapy-type drug. It limits movement in the muscles closest to the trunk of Damon's body, including his thighs, hips, buttocks, chest, shoulders and upper arms.
Warren Rodwell was abducted from his home in the Philippines by Islamist militants in December 2011. He was held against his will for 472 days and feared his captors would behead him . Under Australian law, the survivors and families of overseas attacks can claim up to $75,000 in compensation. Prime Minister Tony Abbott would have to declare his kidnapping a terrorist event .
Anjelica 'AJ' Hadsell, 18, has been missing since March 2, when she was on a break from Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia. Remains were found outside a residence in Franklin, Virginia, on Thursday morning. The body has been sent to the Chief Medical Examiner's Office to be identified and to determine the cause of death, police said .
Lxy Wood, 13, and her brother Nick, 16, disrupted a movie screening of Cinderella in Bessemer, Alabama. Their mother Kyesha Smith Wood, 36, said they were 'rude and obnoxious' during the film. She posted a message on Facebook to find the mother of her daughter's victim, Rebecca Boyd. Mrs Boyd said that her husband had just been laid off and the teenagers had ruined the last time she would be taking her daughter to the movies for a while. The post was shared thousands of times, prompting Mrs Boyd to write a message of apology. Mrs Wood and Mrs Boyd have now met and Mrs Wood has offered to pay for their next trip .

Xiao Zhengti, now five, was born with congenital biliary atresia, a rare liver condition. Mother Yang Haiying donated a portion of her liver to try and save her son, but his body rejected it. Father Xiao Kunqing was also found to be a match for the boy, but surgeons warned against a second operation. But surgeons eventually relented and he had 40 per cent of his liver removed and transplanted into him yesterday .
The Red Lady of El Mirón was buried 18,700 years ago in a cave in Cantabria, Spain. Her body was found in 2010 in the cave stained in sparkling red paint and adorned in yellow flowers with an engraved stone nearby. Researchers found spores of several mushroom species embedded in her teeth .
James Ritchie was forced to resign from his role as women's officer for the Tasmanian University Union. Public pressure and an online petition opposed the decision to employ a male for the job. The student union has now introduced a requirement that candidates sign a statutory declaration confirming female.

The pet, who is also completely deaf, had the scan last month after his owner Lynne Edwards noticed a lump behind his ear. When he returned from the clinic she realised something was wrong when he started refusing food and found puss oozing from back.
Up to 2500 passengers are stranded on a cruise ship, the Carnival Spirit, outside Sydney Harbour. Waves of nine metres have been battering the ship for the past 24 hours. Carnival Spirit was returning from a 12-night cruise to New Caledonia, Vanuatu and Fiji but has been stopped by the huge waves. The ship was scheduled to dock at 7:15 this morning but was unable to do so because of the rough seas .
Social Services Minister Scott Morrison will reportedly scrap a provision that allows parents who don't vaccinate their children to claim welfare benefits. The controversial change could put millions of dollars back into the federal government's pocket. Currently around 39,000 Australian children under the age of seven are not vaccinated putting them at risk of catching severe diseases .
The capybara called JoeJoe has near 60,000 Instagram followers. He also has near 5,000 Facebook likes and 1,000 Twitter followers. The rodent lives in Las Vegas with owner.
There were 72 unprovoked shark attacks around the world last year, with three people killed in Australia and South Africa. Only a minority of sharks are any danger to humans, with Great White, Bull and Tiger sharks accounting for the vast majority of attacks. There were 52 shark attacks in US waters in 2014, compared to 29.

Dr Shimron’s work has renewed controversy over the Talpiot tomb, which dates back to the Second Temple period .

Pleasaunce Cottage in Dormans Park near East Grinstead was built in the 1880s by RA Briggs, known as Bungalow Briggs. It is one of the last surviving bungalows in Britain built on the design of Victorian houses in India . The house has four bedrooms, four reception rooms and two bathrooms, one of which is en-suite, and a cellar  .

Emma Dickson, 31, was rushed to hospital after suffering sharp pains on November 2 last year. Doctors told her she had two blood clots which had moved to her lungs and caused a pulmonary embolism. The clots then led to a pleural effusion, a condition which causes fluid to accumulate between the lungs and chest wall. As this fluid collected, Mrs Dickson's left lung collapsed and she was left fighting for her life in hospital for a month  .

Geologist Dr Danny Hilman believes that a site in West Java is revered because it hides an ancient temple built between 9,000 and 20,000 years ago. If true, the claim could rewrite prehistory and shed light on an advanced ancient civilisation. The megalithic site of Gunung Padang was discovered in 1914 and is the largest site of its kind in Indonesia. It is nestled among volcanoes, banana palms and tea plantations 75 miles south of Jakarta.

The Sleep Cycle app tracks a user's sleep as they go through a cycle of sleep phases. It uses the phone's accelerometer to identify phases by tracking movements in bed and wakes users up during their lightest sleep phase, using a pre-defined 30-minute alarm window. The app has more than two million active users and gathered data for the study between 1 June 2014 and 31 March this year from users aged 18 to 55 in 47 countries  .

No images of the new vehicle have yet been released, but a concept is expected to be revealed in two to five years.

It boasts two airstrips and six houses, all with nearby beaches and sweeping ocean views. The 217 hectare island was purchased by former property developer Wendy Wei Mei Wu for AUD $6.75 million. Christine Davidson was diagnosed with terminal brain cancer in 2001. The 61-year-old was told she had between nine months to three years to live. The mother of two passed away on Thursday at an Adelaide nursing home at the age of 61. Four days before she died, her family noticed her diamond engagement ring was missing from her finger at the home .
President Barack Obama became the first American president to visit the island nation since President Ronald Reagan in 1982. Prime Minister Portia Simpson Miller told President Obama the citizens of her country loved him, and she loved him as well. She also asked President Obama to exonerate black nationalist leader Marcus Garvey, who was convicted in the U.S. of mail fraud in the 1920s. President Obama signaled Thursday he will soon remove Cuba from the US list of state sponsors of terrorism, boosting hopes for improved ties as he prepared for his meeting with President Castro. The highly anticipated interaction with Castro will test the power of personal diplomacy as the two leaders attempt to move.
Patrick Morrison raped his niece Sabrina Morrison when she was 13 in March 2007 but authorities falsely said there was no evidence of the attack. The rape kit showed traces of semen but deputies did not collect a blood sample from him and left him walking the streets. For the next four years, he continued to rape the mentally-disabled girl and even got her pregnant. He threatened to kill her if she told anyone about the assaults and she was sent to live in a group home. Finally, in 2011, the case was re-opened and he was arrested and sentenced to 24 years in prison. His rape was among more than 400 sex-crime cases that were inadequately investigated or not looked into at all.

Gabriel, 28, runs her own physiotherapist practice in Cape Town and has several family members in the city meaning she will have been reluctant to relocate to America. Source close to Noah said the pair are still friends .

Public land managers are desperate to reduce the most recent 'significantly rampant population' of the pest. It comes after over 30 government bodies scattered carrots laced with calicivirus around public areas in March. The pest causes millions of dollars of major agricultural and environmental damage each year. About 70-100 per cent of rabbits die once infected with the virus, which damages the animal's liver and gut and causes haemorrhaging.

Bernard Whalen's new book charts the early rise of the NYPD from it beginnings in 1898 when the New York area's 18 independent police forces merged into one. A variety of men led the force through its formative years, 21 in total. It monitors a home around the clock so it can tell users if they have left their oven on, if their washing is finished and if the water is cold. Motaz Zaid, 20, was with a friend in Parsons Green, south west London, in the early hours of Friday. Masked men sprayed them with ammonia and assaulted them with pliers and tools. Friend, 19, was stabbed several times in the back and legs during the ordeal.
Zbigniew Huminski, 38, was indicted for kidnapping, raping and murdering nine-year-old Chloe. He was on his way to see his sister in Southampton when he 'stopped for a beer' in Calais and attacked her. Huminski has a long criminal record in France and Poland and was banned from France for earlier offences. His lawyer said: 'I have not been able to speak much with him, he does not talk much and, it seems, is in shock' .

By day they are pushed to their physical limits with assault courses and self-defence lessons. By night, they are subjected to vile racist indoctrination which many hoped had disappeared from South Africa.

Officers also reportedly accessed files containing information about Daniel Kerr, a fellow former West Coast Eagles player. Acting Commissioner of West Australian Police, Stephen Brown confirmed an internal investigation is underway. Allegations will be investigated under Criminal Code.

Little is known about the man pictured wearing a uniform and slouch hat. He was a soldier of the First Australian Imperial Force, and his photograph was taken sometime between 1915 and 1918 in Sydney. The campaign invites Aussies to create a profile picture and cover photo for their Facebook page.

The Utah DMV denied his request, citing state regulations prohibiting the use of the number 69 because of its sexual connotations. He was an armored personnel carrier's gunner during his time in the Army, suffering blindness .

The Baird Televisor was manufactured in 1928 - two years after Logie Baird first demonstrated a working TV system. The wooden set has a spiral punched scanning disc which has been fully restored and still has its original tube. It is being auctioned off as part of a speciality telecommunications sale by Auction Team Breker in Cologne.

 Durham University scientists studied a 'clump' of dark matter that appears to be lagging behind its galaxy. The discovery was made around one of the galaxies in the Abell 3827 cluster, 1.3 billion light-years away. It is the first time dark matter has been seen interacting with a force other than gravity. If the particles collide with each other, the friction from the collisions would cause the dark matter to slow down .

The jury recommended that Luna be sentenced to life in prison without parole. Defense attorneys acknowledged that Luna fired the fatal shot from a passing car that he was riding in, but contended that he meant only to scare Lane. Luna did not testify and the defense called just one witness, Luna's mother, Jennifer Luna, who insisted from the witness stand that her son would never hurt anyone intentionally. Lane's parents and sister expressed satisfaction with the outcome of the trial .

Giant concrete arrows were once markers for early airmail flights across the US - forming the first land-based navigation system in the world. They were placed at the base of lit beacons near airways, showing pilots the direction they needed to fly in to reach the next stop-off to deliver mail. Retired couple Brian and Charlotte Smith have found 102 arrows so far and hope to find more in 2013.
The Toyal Lotus technology is inspired by the water-repellent nature of a lotus leaf. It uses microscopic bumps to stop liquids from sticking to lids of yoghurt pots. Toyo Aluminium's technology won silver place in the 2013 Du Pont awards for packaging innovation.

Price of a funeral is rising fast thanks to higher costs for cremation, rising undertakers' bills and churches' fees. The oldest active pilot is a 95-year-old man living in Cameron Park, California. Guinness World Records has confirmed Peter Weber Jr.'s feat. Deep brain stimulation is a technique already used to treat Parkinson's disease. Device sends electrical impulses to specific parts of the brain to cause new brain cells to be formed. Tests on rats found the therapy improved their powers of recall within 24 hours.

The video was created by the Washington-based American Chemical Society (ACS) as part of its Reactions series. It covers three household cleaning 'hacks' for windows, carpets and counter tops. Acetic acid sits at a 2.4 on the pH scale making it very acidic. Vinegar ‘eats away’ at mineral deposits on windows including moisture and dust, while rubbing alcohol absorbs greasy dirt.

Would go three days without eating a single thing and would starve herself if she didn't eat. Was finally admitted to an eating disorder clinic after developing a kidney infection in 2011. Has now gained weight to be a healthy size 8 and is studying graphics at university  .

National Grid has revealed the UK's first new pylon for nearly 90 years. Called the T-pylon, it is a third shorter than the old lattice pylons. National Grid is building a training line of six T-Pylons in Nottinghamshire.

The research was carried out by scientists at the Niels Bohr Institute at the University of Copenhagen. They looked at how big the glaciers were, and how similar they were to glaciers on Earth. There are thought to be thousands of glacier-like formations on the planet in both the northern and southern hemispheres. They are located on Mars between latitude 30.0 and 50.0 - equivalent to just south of Denmark’s location on Earth . The ice must be protected by dust .

Gruesome death rituals performed 1,200 years ago have been uncovered in dozens of tombs in Peru's Cotahuasi Valley. Each tomb was filled with bones of up to 60 mummies, with infants kept in small containers and others repeatedly ripped to pieces while decomposing. Archaeologists have so far opened up seven of the tombs, recovering 171 broken mummies. The Middle Horizon period (A.D. 600–1000) was a time of sweeping cultural change in the Andes .

There were at least three reports of people trying to release gopher tortoises in the ocean because they were mistaken for sea turtles. All five species of sea turtle and the gopher turtle nest in the sand which is why some people may confuse one with the other. It's important to know that you should never attempt to relocate gopher Tortoise adults, juveniles or hatchlings near a beach.

She disappeared under the water several times, screaming for help each time she resurfaced. Baylee Almon was one of 19 toddlers killed in a daycare center on April 19, 1995, in the worst case of homegrown terrorism America has ever seen. The Oklahoma City bombing, planted by veteran US Army soldier Timothy McVeigh, killed 168 American people. One photograph encapsulated the terror: a firefighter emerging from the burning wreckage cradling the lifeless body of Baylee. Her 23-year-old single mother saw the picture on the front page of the local paper the next day. Two decades on, the shock is still raw.

Mr Asbo was moved to a location 60 miles away in 2012 by river authorities after repeatedly attacking rowers. Asbaby was seen at the weekend attacking tourists, eating sandwiches, drinking from water bottles and even trying to steal a woman’s handbag.

Qasr al-Farid or 'The Lonely Castle' is the largest of 131 monumental tombs in the Mada'in Saleh region of the Arabian peninsula. It is situated on one of the most important ancient trade routes linking the north and south of the peninsula. UNESCO declared it a World Heritage Site in 2008.
Sheila Elkan, 84, lives in the house that featured as the Leadbetters' home in 1970s TV series. The great-grandmother-of-five has resided at the home in Hillingdon, north-west London, since 1986. Alaska Airlines Flight 448 bound for Los Angeles was forced to return to Seattle-Tacoma International Airport on Monday when passengers heard banging and pleas for help coming from beneath the aircraft. The worker, an employee of airline contractor Menzies Aviation, had dozed off inside the plane at the end of his shift and woke 14 minutes into the flight. The terrified man called 911 and spoke to a bemused operator for 44 seconds .

The predicted life spans of women aged 65, 75, 85, 85 and 95 fell in 2012. First time since 1995 that falls in all four age groups were recorded. By 2013, the average 75-year-old woman could expect to live another 13 years and five weeks less. For a woman aged 85, the expected span was six years and 42 weeks less .

Researchers from Stanford University used data from 6,588 registered users to determine which colours are most commonly associated with which letters. They then compared these colour-letter matches to fridge magnets sold by Fisher-Price between 1971 and 1990. The results revealed that at least six per cent (400 out of the 6588 participants) learnt 'many of their matches' from the toy. For participants born between 1970 and 1985, the prevalence of synesthesia can exceed 15%.
Noel Marshall’s action-adventure film was originally released in 1981 and its 11-year production is infamous for the injuries received by 70 members of the cast and crew. The film revolves around a wildlife preservationist who lives with his wife and children alongside a number of wild lions, tigers, cheetahs and elephants. The idea for the film came about when Noel Marshall and Tippi Hedren discovered an abandoned plantation house overrun by a large pride of lions while touring wildlife preserves in Africa. Roar is being re-released.

In 1928, the Easter act was passed in Parliament to make sure that the holiday weekend would be a fixed date in April. Both the House of Commons and House of Lords passed the Act but it was unable to get the agreement of churches. It is thought the Roman Catholic Church did not object to plans.

Anti-fungal agent miconazole and steroid clobetasol restored movement to mice paralysed by MS. Prompted mouse and human stem cells to regenerate myelin, the protective coating around nerve fibres. Discovery could pave the way to ground-breaking new therapies for the disease.

Two sets of maps include image mosaics and topographical views of the lunar landscape taken over a period of four years. Darker blue show deep craters, while the grey and white areas reveal areas of elevation. The map also shows Mare Orientale, an impact crater that was partially flooded by basalts. To the left of these craters is Oceanus Procellarum, which is Latin for 'Ocean of Storms', a region created by an asteroid.

The alarm clock, called Wakē, rouses individuals from their slumber one at a time using a focused beam of light and sound. The wall-mounted device creates a ‘personal sunrise’ and emits focused ultrasonic waves to wake up each person in bed individually. It uses a white LED to slowly illuminate the area around a sleeper’s face to gently wake them up, with the aim of making them feel alert faster  .

The creature, named Hyalinobatrachium dianae, was found in the mountains of eastern Costa Rica. While most of its body is lime green, the skin on its underside is see-though, making its organs easily visible. The animal’s heart, liver and gastrointestinal tract are easily visible thanks to translucent skin. The frog was named by Brian Kubicki who discovered it, after his mother to thank her for supporting his interest in science.

The interactive map was created by writer Levi Pearson, who used a dataset from the National UFO Reporting Centre and open source software from CartoDB. It begins in 1933 with the first UFO sightings being spotted over California and Nebraska in the US, the UK and France in Europe, and locations in Japan and Australia. The number of sightings increases dramatically between the 1940s and the 1960s across the world. This could be down to the development of drones and new aircraft technologies, or a genuine rise in alien activity .

Emma Hannigan had her breasts and ovaries removed in 2006 to reduce her risk of cancer. She was diagnosed with faulty BRCA1 gene, which increases chance of getting breast cancer by 85 per cent. The mother-of-two opted to have a double mastectomy and oophorectomy the following year to reduce risk. A year later, she was told she had breast cancer and has battled the disease nine times since. She is now undergoing chemotherapy every three weeks to keep the disease at bay.

More than 700 Asiatic black bears, over a third of those held in captivity in Vietnam, have allegedly been butchered in the past year alone. Four bears inexplicably killed in one day on some farms in Halong Bay, Cau Trang, in November. Paws, meat and gall bladders of 'moon bears' sold for the equivalent of £625 a bear and smuggled to China for use in traditional medicine. Officials under growing international pressure to rescue the animals.
Students at McGuffey High School in Pennsylvania organized a so-called Anti-Gay Day protest. They wore flannel shirts and wrote 'Anti-Gay' on their hands and Bible verses on lockers. The event was a reaction to a Day Of Silence event for bullied LBGT students the previous day. Concerned parents have called for action.
Many Californians are taking extreme measures to conserve water in the face of the state's historic drought. Robin Weld of Sacramento has converted her home's toilet into a toilet-sink that doubles as a sink and used washing machine water to water fruit trees. Scott Mathers of Brentwood has installed a 10,000-gallon rainwater tank under his home as well as a smaller tank to collect gray water. Chris Brown uses the condensation from his home's air conditioning units to irrigate plants.
Flight Lieutenant Stephen Beaumont took his teddy bear mascot with him on every Spitfire and Defiant flight. Sunken yacht was owned by King Kamehameha II, aka Liholiho, the second king of Hawaii, when it sank in April 1824 off the coast of Kauai, Hawaii. Divers recovered more than 1,200 artifacts from the wreckage over a five-year period from 1995 to 2001. The artifacts include gold, silver, Hawaiian poi pounders, gemstones, a boat whistle, knives, forks, mica and more.

Nasa has released an infographic explaining which worlds in the solar system are thought to have oceans under their surface. Water is important because life needs it to survive .

People in California, for instance, are far more worried about the warming planet than those in parts of the central US. Concern about global warming ranges from an estimated low of 38 per cent in Pickett County, Tennessee, to a high of 74 per cent. in Washington, D.C.  .

Images show a shoal of fish making way for a blacktip shark swimming in the shallow waters of Heron Island in Queensland, Australia. It is thought that the reef shark was not interested in catching a meal, but the fish naturally keep their distance, creating circles of clear water around the predator. Dr Ken Collins, Senior Research Fellow and Diving Officer at the University of Southampton, said: 'This is fairly typical behaviour for shoaling fish, the same would happen if it were a diver in the photograph rather than a shark'

Her siblings Bol, one, four-year-old twins Madit and Anger and brother Bol died after their mother Akon Guode crashed her 4WD into a lake at Wyndham Vale in Melbourne's outer west on Wednesday. Awel remains in a serious condition at the Royal Children's Hospital but she remembers the accident. Her father Joseph Tito Manyang says Awel believes the children were taken by a crocodile because the children associate the giant reptiles with water. The children's mother was released from police custody on Thursday night .
Jenny Wallenda was the oldest daughter of high wire walker Karl Wallenda and grandmother of daredevil performer Nik Wallenda. Wallenda's husband, Richard Faughnan, died in 1962 when a human pyramid collapsed. Jenny Wallenda survived the invasion of Berlin by Soviet forces at the end of World War II and returned to the United States in 1947 to perform with her family.

He said he believes illegal employment will flourish under system.

It is a cover of the song from 1983 film MontyPython's Meaning of Life. Professor Hawking, 73, appeared on film alongside Professor Brian Cox. The video is interspersed with clips of recent live shows.
Lee Garlington is opening up about his three year relationship with Hollywood star Rock Hudson in an interview with People. He says he would sneak over to Hudson's house after work, spend the night and leave the next morning. The two would bring a date with them to social events so people would not know they were dating. The relationship lasted for three years, from 1962 until 1965. Hudson would never publicly come out of the closet before his death in 1985 .

Price of a funeral is rising fast thanks to higher costs for cremation, rising undertakers’ bills as funeral firms are faced with bad debts, and increasing fees.

Teller Lake in Boulder, Colorado, has been invaded by 3,000 to 4,000 goldfish, which officials say started as pets two or three years ago. The fish are threatening to over-run the natural species in the lake, eating up all their resources and spreading diseases. Officials are now considering two options - draining the lake or electroshocking the fish. The latter is the most likely option, where the fish are stunned by an electrical current and removed while they float.

He did not see the toddler and ran her over as he pulled his truck up in the driveway to move the trash cans. Kendra suffered severe head trauma and was unconscious when medical workers arrived, and was pronounced dead shortly after at a nearby hospital. This is now the fourth time since August that a child was accidentally run over and killed in Utah.

Kendalia Halle was built more than 100 years ago by German immigrants, who through the latter half of the 19th century comprised more than 5 percent of the state's population. It's one of an estimated 1,000 dance halls that sprung up around Texas in the 1800s, knitting together German, Czech, Polish and other immigrant communities. About 400 such halls still stand — many unused and decaying .

Kuku Kube is available for free on Facebook, Android, iOS and on desktop browsers. It has been designed to put your colour vision and eyesight to the test by showing boards of coloured squares. On each board, one of the squares is a slightly different shade of the same colour. Aim is to find this odd square by tapping it with your finger or clicking it with the mouse  .

During his career, Castro also served as an American ambassador to three countries including El Salvador, Bolivia and Argentina. He became known as 'Yankee Castro' to differentiate him from the other Raul Castro — the brother of Cuban dictator Fidel Castro. Castro is survived by his wife and two daughters .

Hawaii scientists say a supervoid may account for an anomaly in the cosmic microwave background radiation (CMB) of the universe. In 2004 astronomers first found the 'Cold Spot' - a region 20 per cent less dense than elsewhere. The theory was proposed by astronomers seeking to understand what is causing this larger-than-expected cold area. If confirmed, the supervoid would be the largest single structure ever found by humanity. It would be three billion light-years from Earth and would be 1.8 billion light years across.

Experts say mothers should wait at least 18 months to give their body time to recover and increase the chances the next child is full-term and healthy. The study released on Thursday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that about 30 percent of women who'd had a child became pregnant again within 18 months. White women had the shortest spacing — about 2 years, 2 months on average. Black and Hispanic women typically waited 2½ years or longer and black and hispanic women waited longer.

Scientists in California have described how to create artificial auroras on Earth. They said a particle accelerator could be sent 185 miles (300km) up into space. It would then fire high-energy beams back at Earth's atmosphere. The beams would excite atoms and create fantastic colours - which we see on the ground as auroras. It could even trigger different forms of lightning in the atmosphere .
A Washington, DC-based company called United Space Structures wants to create a new space station. Their giant cylinder could apparently replace the ISS. It would rotate four times per minute to create artificial gravity, and would be 1,300ft (400 metres) long. The main cylindrical body would spin in one direction, the top dome-shaped section would spin the other. This would allow spacecraft to dock with the top of the station, which would appear stationary. The structure would take 30 years to build and cost close to £300 billion.

Scientists have found traces of compounds found in camomile and yarrow in the hardened plaque of 50,000-year-old Neanderthal teeth found in El Sidron, Spain. At first researchers thought they might have been using these plants as a form of self-medication. But new research suggests they may have used them to make food more palatable. Forecasters expect the South to reach 17C (63F) tomorrow, 21C (70F) on Tuesday, 23C on Wednesday and 20C on Thursday. Five flood alerts are in place today - for Devon, Cornwall, Somerset, Bristol and Cumbria. His trial included lurid details of how he sought advice from others in the online 'death-porn' community over how to kidnap and kill his wife. He was sentenced to time served in November for illegally accessing a federal database. He has been out of jail since July after being cleared of conspiring to abduct, cook and eat.

A 13-page checklist from the Gemini 4 mission in June 1965 is tipped to sell for £80,000 ($120,000) The list shows the various steps the astronauts had to go through when opening and closing the hatch to space. One of them cut their hand or finger on the hatch locking mechanism and their blood ended up on the checklist after they removed their gloves while safely inside. Had the pair not been able to lock the hatch after themselves, they would have been lost in space. And had that happened, it could easily have scuppered the Apollo missions that followed including the moon landings.
Chelsea Manning, 27, has given her first in-depth interview from behind bars in Fort Leavenworth, Kansas. The former intelligence analyst was convicted of espionage in July 2013 for sending a trove of classified documents to WikiLeaks. She was sentenced to 35 years in prison. Manning, a former army private who enlisted as Bradley, has had her name officially changed to Chelsea. She recently received approval to undergo hormone therapy for gender reassignment while in prison and is taking hormones  .

Filmmaker Michael König from Cologne, Germany has created an amazing video showing solar activity. It was made by stitching together footage from Nasa's Solar Dynamics Observatory over five years. The movie, called Sun, shows plasma raining down on the sun, an extreme solar eruption and even a comet breezing through the sun’s atmosphere. Highlights of the video include large, bright tendrils extending outward from the sun's surface and occasionally crashing down again - known as solar prominences - as well as magnetic fields .

The long-necked dinosaur was one of the largest animals to ever walk the Earth. But for more than a century scientists believed the creature was originally misnamed. Instead of belonging to the genus, or species 'family' Brontosaurus, they said it should in fact have been classified as 'Apatosaurus' Now new research has shown that it is sufficiently different from Apatosaurus to deserve its own genus name. Scientists looked at 477 anatomical features across 81 individual dinosaurs.

Three studies have provided different theories for what happened after Earth was struck by a Mars-sized object called Theia, 4.45 billion years ago. What is agreed on, though, is that the impact actually happened. Both bodies have a similar isotopic ‘fingerprint,’ notably similar types of Tungsten, suggesting they had a similar origin. One difference is that Earth has proportionally much less of a lighter isotope known as Tundsten-182 than Theia  .

Historic building repairer Gregg Olson and architectural historian Pam Hayden have been analyzing the Molalla Log Cabin for seven years. They believe the log cabin could have been built as early as 1795 - ten years before Lewis and Clark reached the Pacific Ocean. The way the logs are tightly interwoven, secured without nails and left no gaps is similar to Russian log cabins of the same time period, when Catherine the Great was sending envoys to Alaska to boost the fur trade .
Sour cherries contain high levels of antioxidants and as a result are anti-inflammatory, can help a person sleep and can improve recovery after a sports injury. Avocados are a great source of healthy, mono-saturated fats, which have been shown to lower bad cholesterol and reduce heart attack risk.

Jennifer Pagonis, 29, has Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome (AIS), a very rare disorder which prevents a womb from growing and causes testes to grow in the abdomen. She was born with an enlarged clitoris, no uterus and a partial vagina that surgeons later extended so that as an adult she might have normal sexual intercourse. She now uses the first name 'Pidgeon,' doesn't identify as female or male and works as an artist and intersex activist against surgery against surgery .

US researchers discovered that a single gene called TcSAD1 is responsible for the melting point of cocoa butter. Plant geneticists say their finding could also lead to new varieties of climate change-resistant cocoa plants. Chocolate with a higher or lower melting point would be useful for production of chocolate with specific textures and specialty applications, such as cosmetics.

The seven-car Maglev - short for 'magnetic levitation' - hit a top speed of 375mph (603 km/h) and travelled for almost 11 seconds at speeds above 373mph. It beat last week's speeds of 366mph (590kph), which in turn beat the train's previous record of 361mph (581kph) Maglev trains use magnets to lift the carriages above the track and is propelled by electrically charged magnets. The technology promises a ride that's smoother, quieter and almost twice as fast as trains.

A finger-width flexible tube called an endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) allows doctors to see inside the lungs and take a tissue sample in one go. Patients who have undergone EBUS survive for 503 days after diagnosis, compared with 312 days for people assessed through more traditional methods.

A Senate panel is set to vote tomorrow on an intensely debated bill authored by Senate Foreign Affairs Chairman Bob Corker that would give Congress a say on a potential deal aimed at keeping Tehran from developing a nuclear weapon. Under the bill, Obama could unilaterally lift or ease any sanctions imposed on Iran through presidential executive means. But it would prohibit him for 60 days from suspending, waiving or otherwise easing any sanctions that Congress levied on Iran. If Congress passed a joint resolution disapproving it, Obama would be blocked from providing Iran with relief.
Luca Railton was born with bones missing from his legs due to the rare condition bilateral tibial hemimelia. Doctors said he would have to have his right leg amputated or fused straight when he was 10-years-old. But his family refused to give up and raised £135,000 to take him to the US for treatment. He has now taken his first steps unaided .

The Great Dying, which struck the Earth 252 million years ago, wiped out more than 96% of the world's creatures. It took place over a 60,000-year period, and acidification of the oceans lasted for around 10,000 years. The study, led by the University of Edinburgh, is the first to show that highly acidic oceans were to blame. In particular, they claim the volcanic eruptions released huge amounts of carbon dioxide which were absorbed into the oceans and changed their chemical compositions  .

Steiner said they were transporting the dogs to his wife's family in Pennsylvania because his father could no longer keep them. Adele Sarno, 85, has been living in her two-bedroom apartment in Manhattan's Little Italy for more than 50 years. Her landlord is the Italian American Museum which is dedicated to the legacy of Italian-Americans and is situated below her home. They sent her a letter five years ago seeking to increase rent to $3,500 a month, far more than the retired shopkeeper can afford. The spat is the latest involving the museum to cause a commotion in Little Italy, a neighborhood of former tenement buildings and narrow streets in Lower Manhattan that was once a bustling center of Italian immigrant life.

Many nations are looking into Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) technologies as a way to cut their greenhouse house emissions. CCS refers to the process of capturing carbon released by burning fossil fuels and storing it in porous rock layers in areas such as depleted oil and gas reservoirs. The technology has the potential to reduce the emissions of a typical coal-power plant by up to 90 per cent. But there are concerns over storing such huge amounts of carbon underground. Last April, an IPCC report highlighted a number of barriers to using CCS, including fatal CO2 leaks, transport issues and operational risks .

Today marks 81 years since the notorious 'Surgeon's Photograph', which claimed to show evidence of a monster living in Loch Ness, was published in the Daily Mail. To celebrate, Google has launched its latest Street View experience that lets you virtually explore both above and beneath the water in the iconic Scottish waterway. The tech giant has also released a Google Doodle to commemorate the anniversary and changed the yellow Pegman to a Nessie peg-monster. Google partnered with Catlin Seaview Survey and Adrian Shine .

The University of Sydney student is raising funds for HeartKids Australia - supporting thousands of children living with heart defects. Malachy Frawley died from heart disease in 2013 when he was just 14 years old. He was five years Callum's junior, but they forged a truly special friendship. Callum has never run a marathon before.
The search zone for missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 will be doubled if nothing is found in the huge undersea area now being scanned for wreckage. The expanded search will 'cover the entire highest probability area identified by expert analysis', Australian Deputy Prime Minister Warren Truss said. The search has focused on 60,000 square kilometres of deep ocean off the coast of Western Australia's west coast.

Created by artist Paul Erard in the Swiss city of La Chaux-de-Fonds, the petite pistol measures just two inches long. The gun currently holds the Guinness World Record for the smallest working revolver. It fires purpose-made bullets just 2.34mm in diameter - the smallest live ammunition ever created.

The bone was discovered during excavations ahead of a new pipeline in Landford, Essex. It was placed into a pit with a diameter of about three feet (one metre) and then backfilled with soil. Three radiocarbon dates, two from bone fragments and one from charcoal, have confirmed the remains are around 7,614 years old. The find is significant because it sheds light on early human society in Mesolithic Britain before the arrival of farming.
Random Darknet Shopper was designed as an online shopping system that spent up to $100 each week. It bought items on the 'dark net' - the part of the internet that does not show up in searches or social media. Swiss police 'arrested' it after it bought 10 Ecstasy tablets in a DVD case.
Obese people appear to be protected against dementia, with a risk around 30 per cent lower than those of healthy weight. Findings contradict many previous studies which have suggested being fat with a high Body Mass Index could raise risk.

Footprints found at Ileret in Kenya are the oldest human footprints in the world. They were made by a species of early human that walked much like we do. The prints were left by Homo erectus - an extinct species of human that disappeared around 200,000 years ago. They are the strongest evidence yet that they were sophisticated hunters  .

German firm Automatic Storage Device (ASD) and designer Wolfram Walter have created the Sonnenspeicher. It uses a lithium iron phosphate battery to store energy harvested during the day by solar panels. This energy is used throughout the day, and any excess is stored for when the sun goes down. Rather than selling this excess electricity back to the grid, homeowners can use this stored supply to power their home until the sun rises again. It features an intelligent management system that automatically controls the charging and discharging of the battery .
German photographer Dieter Klein travelled the world to find vintage cars left to crumble in leafy forests and fields. He came across a range of mysterious graveyards hosting all sorts of vehicles, including a rare Jaguar XK120, which, if restored, could be worth £82,000 .

Last month's average temperature of 56.4°F (13.6°C) was 1.5°F above the average for the 20th century. This was the highest for March in the 1880-2015 record, surpassing the previous record of 2010 by 0.09°F. NOAA scientist Jessica Blunden blames the heat on El Niño, climate change and human-caused blob.

The surrender of Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee to Union Lt. Gen. Ulysses S. Grant 150 years ago on Thursday was a milestone event in the end of the Civil War. Lee's forces were in a state of growing disarray in the hours before Lee formally called it quits. The Union Army had already smashed their way into the Confederate capital of Richmond, Virginia days earlier that month, and had already crossed the Appomattox River.

Six years and 600 prison letters later, Kreth says she's learned that a Sociath is a person 'who wants to feel like the smartest person in the room' 'They do it for the thrill,' she said, adding that she does not condone any of the perpetrators crimes. The list of killers Kreth interacted with include Michael Swango and Sarah Joe Pender.

University of East Anglia scientists have developed an adaptor for colour blindness. Eye2TV can be plugged into any HDMI port on a TV or a computer monitor. A remote control or app then adjusts the colour adjustment. It allows colour blind people to watch shows they otherwise couldn't.

The USS Independence is resting 800m underwater off California's Farallon Islands with its hull and deck very well preserved. There also appears to be a plane in the hangar bay of the vessel, scientists said on Thursday. The aircraft carrier survived an atomic bomb test after being chosen as a 'target vessel' for Operation Crossroads in 1946. It was decommissioned in August 1946 before its highly radioactive hull was taken to San Francisco five years later. Controversy surrounds its sinking as some believe it contaminated wildlife.
Brendan Rodgers fined for leaving a house he rented out in Accrington to rot. Liverpool boss ordered to pay £400 and £375 costs at Blackburn magistrates' court. Rodgers and business partner Judith O'Hagan were found guilty of ignoring an improvement notice issued by Hyndburn Council.

Study analysed DNA from 21,566 men convicted of sex offences in Sweden between 1973 and 2009. Sons and brothers of convicted sex offenders were four to five times more likely to be convicted. In only 2% of cases could this familial connection be explained by shared environmental factors. This can include social or environmental aspects of their upbringing that siblings would have experienced together.

Electoral Commission rules state food and entertainment cannot be provided by candidates if intended to influence votes.
