Scientists in The Netherlands were using the Lofar radio telescope to study lightning. They found it could measure changes in lightning caused by cosmic rays. A storm can have hundreds of millions of volts over multiple kilometres. The method could provide a novel way to understand thunderclouds. Cosmic rays are up to a billion times more energetic than particles at Cern's Large Hadron Collider in the universe.
Britain has long seen prosecco as the second choice to champagne, now that's all changing. Last year UK sales overtook those of champagne for the first time - £181.8 million compared with £141.3 million. Sales have increased by 28 per cent since 2012.
Andrew Hutchinson raped two patients while they were under general anaesthetic at John Radcliffe Hospital Oxford. The 29-year-old was convicted of 23 separate charges last month including making indecent images of children. In 2009 a student nurse reported Hutchinson as having taken inappropriate photographs at the hospital. Staff at Oxford University Hospitals Trust chose not to investigate the complaint as there was not sufficient evidence .
Identical twins share 100 per cent of their genes, meaning it has been impossible to tell which sibling a sample comes from. Researchers at the University of Huddersfield have created a technique which can distinguish between the genetic fingerprints of identical twins. Method is called high resolution melt curve analysis (HRMA) The more hydrogen bonds present in DNA, the higher the temperature needed to melt them. This is because different life experiences create variations in the number of hydrogen bonds in the DNA .
Carl Bradey lost everything he owned in the blaze, which was started by a candle in his Palmerston North rental property last month. The 25-year-old smashed through a window to rescue the child of a family friend, suffering nerve damage. He has undergone four major operations, including multiple skin grafts and the removal of a damaged vein .
Andrew Steele had pleaded not guilty by reason of mental disease to two counts of first-degree intentional homicide in the August 22 shooting deaths of his wife, Ashlee Steele, 39, and her sister, 38-year-old Kacee Tollefsbol of Lake Elmo, Minnesota. A jury deliberated for about 10 hours until all but two of the 12 agreed the verdict early on Thursday. Defense attorneys argued that Lou Gehrig's disease had damaged Steele's brain, making him not criminally responsible for the deaths. Steele had been diagnosed with the progressive neurodegenerative disease last June. Forensic psychiatrist Dr. Doug Tucker had testified that a rambling note Steele wrote about suicide and sexual relations was delusional .
French Prime Minister Manuel Valls said five terrorist attacks have been foiled in France since January's Charlie Hebdo massacre. Comments follow arrest of Sid Ahmed Ghlam, 24, who was allegedly preparing to storm churches with weapons. He was caught on Sunday after accidently shooting himself in the leg after allegedly murdering Aurelie Chatelain. DNA evidence also reportedly links him to murder of 33-year-old mother and fitness instructor. Police are now hunting for at least two accomplices linked to him.

The Clinton Foundation and the Clinton Health Access Initiative are refiling at least five years of tax returns. The charities' errors generally took the form of under-reporting or over-reporting donations from foreign governments. The errors appear on the form 990s that all non-profit organizations must file annually with the Internal Revenue Service to maintain their tax-exempt status .
Volcano Calbuco, in southern Chile, erupted for the first time in more than 40 years on Wednesday. It sent a huge plume of gas and ash soaring into the sky which was visible from up to 100 miles away. An estimated 1,500 people were forced to flee the nearby town of Ensenada after the eruption at around 6pm.

He had argued that on the night in question he and his wife had been affectionate but had not had any sexual contact . The case highlighted issues around consent when one person in a couple is diagnosed with dementia and Alzheimers is unable to consent .

Curiously absent from the final vote was Texas Senator Ted Cruz - a key opponent of Lynch's nomination. He was the only member of the Senate who did not cast a vote. A BMJ analysis of 40 random episodes of his show revealed that his recommendations were supported by evidence only 46 percent of the time. Oz also included a statement from the BMJ, which he described as his harshest critic.
Andrea Yates drowned her five children in the bathtub of their Texas home in June 2001. She was convicted of capital murder in 2002 and sentenced to life in prison. But an appeals court granted her a retrial and she was found not guilty by reason of insanity in 2006. Her ex-husband Rusty, who has since remarried and has a five-year-old son, slammed her murder trial as the 'cruelest thing he had ever witnessed' .

George also didn't hesitate to speak his mind, even if it was unscripted and, at times, controversial, said Seattle Archbishop J. Peter Sartain, who delivered the homily at a packed funeral Mass at Chicago's Holy Name Cathedral on Thursday .
Dutch natural scientist Antoni van Leeuwenhoek used his body as a guinea pig in an experiment in 1677. He took three lice, nestled them among the hairs of his calf, rolled up a tight stocking and left the stocking on and did not bathe.

A dozen Native American extras and the cultural adviser walked off the set of Adam Sandler's new movie The Ridiculous 6 on Wednesday. The film stars Sandler, Taylor Lautner, Nick Nolte and Steve Buscemi and is a spoof of The Magnificent Seven. One of the extras, Loren Anthony, a Navajo Nation tribal member, said the film was offensive towards Native American women. 'We were supposed to be Apache, but it was really stereotypical and we did not look Apache at all. We looked more like Comanche,' he said . The movie's director, Frank Coraci, said 'It is a satire of movies and stereotypes but in the title is ridiculous' .

His parents, Paul and Suzanne, are now filing a formal complaint against police for the way they were treated after they reported their son missing. Paul claims his wife Suzanne was handcuffed and thrown to the ground by officers after she refused to let them into their home. Police found their son two miles away in the car, and he has since written a letter of thanks them .

This was revealed by his brother Scott during a hearing to determine if he should be released from hospital. He currently spends half of his days institutionalized after being found not guilty by reason of insanity for shooting President Ronald Reagan in 1981. He shot Reagan and three others, including White House press secretary James Brady, in a bid to impress actress Jodie Foster. Testimony is expected to wrap up next week to determine whether he can move in permanently with his mother  .

Bruce Davis, 72, was convicted in the 1969 slayings of musician Gary Hinman and stuntman Donald 'Shorty' Shea and sentenced to life in prison in 1972. Davis, who once bragged of cutting Shea's head off, claimed he has turned his life around in prison, earning a doctoral degree in philosophy, becoming religious and ministering to other inmates. The parole board cited those accomplishments, along with his age and good behavior as reasons.
Oskar Groening told the Lueneburg state court on Thursday that he did not expect Jews at Auschwitz to make it out alive. The 93-year-old's answer came in response to a question from attorneys representing Auschwitz survivors. He is being tried on 300,000 counts of accessory to murder. On Wednesday Groening described how so many Jews were brought to the Auschwitz death camp at once that he was put on a 24-hour shift.
David Billing, 48, was diagnosed with mouth cancer after being unable to swallow. Surgeons sawed through his jawbone and removed part of his tongue to remove the tumour. They then replaced the lost tissue with muscle from Mr Billing's arm, which still has hairs on it. He now has to return to the hospital every few weeks to have it shaved.

The case centers on charges that Deutsche Bank derivatives traders manipulated the London InterBank Offered Rate. Deutsche Bank employees defrauded counterparties in emails, telephone calls and electronic chats, the US said. The $2.5 billion fine is a record for interest-rate manipulation.
41 million tonnes of 'e-waste' worth over £34billion were discarded globally in 2014. But only 6 million tonnes was recycled properly, according to a report by United Nations University. Broken televisions, computers, microwaves and refrigerators are being illegally exported to African countries. They are dumped in landfills like Agbogbloshie in Ghana because it is cheaper than recycling them in Europe. Transporting broken or expired electronics to Africa is illegal under the Basel convention. Brokers exploit loophole by fraudulently labelling items as 'reusable' and selling them to locals without testing them in markets .

The 69-year-old was sentenced to three months' imprisonment, suspended for two years, in September. He was awarded travel and hotel fees for his time on trial at a costs application hearing today. Former radio presenter was cleared of 12 counts of indecent assault.

While serving snacks to the public at the front of the building, a team on the inside was digging their way towards the temple's famous Hua Pagoda. Five men were arrested following a tip-off, but three are still on the run.

Douglas Bader was shot down over France in August 1941 and ended up in a German prison camp in Warburg. It was there that he was involved in a mass break-out that pre-dated the Great Escape in 1944. Bader’s life story has already been the subject of the successful film Reach for the Sky starring Kenneth More. This latest look at his exploits is based on a book on the Warburg escape by historian Mark Felton called Zero Night.

This is despite the fact 10,000 people are killed for their organs every year in China. New satellite images reveal China has built an airstrip on disputed territory in the South China Sea. They reveal the country's rapid progress in constructing the runway on the contested Fiery Cross Reef. The Philippines, Vietnam, Malaysia, Brunei and Taiwan all claim the area near the Spratly Islands. China's building activity has infuriated neighbouring countries and the United States whose leadership accused the country of bullying others .
U.S. President Barack Obama said China is 'using its sheer size and muscle to force countries into subordinate positions' But furious Chinese leadership says it is Washington which possesses the greatest military muscle. Comes as satellite images show Chinese vessels dredging sand onto land masses near disputed islands. Area near the Spratly Islands is claimed by many countries in the South China Sea. China claims the work is necessary to safeguard its sovereignty .
Frank Ernest Shepherd, III of Houston, Texas, led police on a high-speed chase after being pulled over for a traffic stop that ended when he slammed into another vehicle. He then got out of the car and reached into his backseat before being shot by police. The 41-year-old father of three who had another baby on the way was unarmed when he was shot by two officers. No weapons were found in his car and it is not known what he was reaching for   .
Historian Stephen Chambers has collected more than 100 rare photographs of the doomed Gallipoli landings. They include poignant images of soldiers from their preparation for the first landings right up until the evacuation. Soldiers are seen being hosed down on the deck of the SS River Clyde, a mule is hoisted on board and a soldier makes the dash.
Eight faculty members at Columbia University have written an op-ed lashing out at Dr Mehmet Oz's 'unsubstantiated medicine... sullies the reputation' of the university. But they also applauded him for his stellar work at the Ivy League school, where he has been a professor of surgery since 2001. The eight staff wrote the piece after 10 doctors urged Columbia to sever all ties with Oz. Those doctors accused him of being a 'charlatan'  .
Linda Thompson, 64, tweeted a message of support for her former husband ahead of his ABC prime time special with Diane Sawyer set to air on Friday night. It's the first public comment the former beauty queen has made about his rumored transition from male to female. She was married to the Olympic gold medalist from 1981 to 1986. Linda had two sons with Bruce - Brandon and Brody - and both have been seen in teaser videos supporting him.
Researchers examined the brains of more than 900 people aged more than 60 and assessed the pollution risk. Exposure to small, sooty particles, mostly caused by traffic fumes and factory emissions, alters the structure of the brain .
Zermatt in the Upper Valais area of Switzerland has imposed the ban after a report from an animal welfare charity. The dogs are being kept in 'miserable conditions' in an unheated condemned building. The town's mayor said the practice will be stamped out by next winter.
Julie Schenecker, 54, was convicted last May of shooting her son Beau, 13, and daughter Calyx, 16, dead in their Tampa Bay, Florida home in January 2011 while her husband was serving in the Middle East. In an exclusive jailhouse interview, she has claimed she pulled the trigger to 'save' her children, despite previously admitting to authorities that she had shot them for being 'mouthy' She claimed her son was being sexually abused - but would not say by whom - and that Calyx had told her she was suffering from mental illness. Police disputed the claims, saying she had admitted to killing the children .

His mother Kim, 43, says her son was a 'cheeky chappy' and 'lots of fun' who loved dancing and singing. Mother-of-five slams lenient sentence, saying: 'There is no justice at all'
The 2015 World Happiness Report is the third of its kind and is edited by a team of renowned academics and analysts. It measures a country's population by factors contributing to its citizens' contentment, rather than wealth. Britons are happier now than they were two years ago, the study found, but still ranks in at a lowly 21st place. The top 10 on the list is dominated by nations from Scandinavia, particularly those in Scandinavia. Syria, Burundi and Togo are the world's least happy countries.

Fossicker Ashley Manzie found the medal belonging to Frederick George Biddulph, who served with the 23rd Australian Infantry Battalion at Gallipolli between 1914 and 1915. He posted photos of the medal to an online forum, which led him to Sydney man Stephen Norton. Mr Norton says the medal doesn't belong to Frederick at all, but to his brother Lewis William Biddurph. Frederick never joined the army because he lost two fingers blowing up fish before the war. He died nine years before 'Bunny' in New Zealand. The medal is thought to have belonged to Lewis because he had a slight hearing problem. It was found in Melbourne's Springvale Cemetery. The ANZAC Day Centenary is this weekend in Australia    .
Alexis Douglas was playing at her sister's friend's house in Melbourne in January when she was mauled by a pitbull. The five-year-old needed 50 stitches to her face and still requires treatment for the next three years. Her mother Monique Douglas says she cries every day for her daughter who is unable to play outside by herself. The dog's owner escaped without a conviction for not registering his pitbull  .
Drug firm GlaxoSmithKline has applied for a licence from the European Medicines Agency. RTS,S is the first malaria vaccine to reach advanced trials. Tests carried out on 15,500 toddlers and babies in sub-Saharan Africa in the final stages of testing.

Anthony Trollope introduced post boxes to the UK in 1852 after seeing them in France. The first boxes were erected in Jersey as a trial before appearing across mainland Britain. There are now 115,300 post boxes.

Her father, Tom Parks, wrote an obituary openly discussing her struggle with drugs. He pleaded with other families to 'stay right on top' of loved ones with addictions and get help for them .

On the day of his release last November, the moment he ate his first burger after being in prison for decades was captured on video. In a video posted on April 20 by the California Innocence Project, he is seen at the counter of a Carl's Jr asking for a hamburger 'with the bacon on it' .

But it is best known for that infamous scene in the 1986 teen comedy starring Matthew Broderick. The car, in classic Ferrari red, was the pride and joy of the father of Ferris Bueller's best friend Cameron. In the movie, the friends take the model out for a spin which results in the convertible smashing into the ravine.

Grimes said she suffered lasting injuries, including a concussion and a broken nose that required surgery. Saban claimed it was Grimes who attacked her first and she was just defending herself. Grimes portrayed Kristen Saban as the aggressor, but a judge in Tuscaloosa cited Alabama's 'stand your ground' law in ruling that Saban only defended herself against Grimes. The one-sentence dismissal motion did not give a reason for the move, but it said each woman should pay her own costs.
Two Up is one of Australia's longest lasting traditions, dating back to the late 1790s. It is now legal to be played on ANZAC Day across Returned Servicemen League clubs (RSL) and pubs. Punting analyst Mike Steward has outlined an approach, known in gambling parlance as the Martingale Betting Strategy, which originated in France.

Lack of natural daylight is thought to be driving up rates of short-sightedness among the young. Chinese scientists have reported a 23 per cent reduction in myopia in children who spend an extra 40 minutes a day in the sunshine. Other studies have shown similar results in Australia.

The Bolshevik leader's remains were embalmed on Stalin's orders when he died aged 53 in 1924. His body is on public display in a mausoleum on Moscow's Red Square more than two decades after the break-up of the former USSR. Artist Frank McKeever from Florida created these amazing posters. They show how we could colonise various worlds in the solar system. Included are humans skiing on a moon of Uranus and living in cities on Mars. Others show life on Europa and near Saturn - and a destroyed Earth. And he hopes the posters encourage us to expand our presence into the solarsystem. This is especially as our planet is vulnerable to cosmic disasters - and is prone to asteroids .

Anzac Day fell on a Saturday this year, meaning all states but WA will miss out on a public holiday. The agreement was designed to provide uniformity of public holidays across the nation. If Easter, Christmas, Australia Day, the Queen's Birthday or Labour Day fall on a weekend, a holiday is granted on a weekday. Western Australia and some public servants in Canberra have decided to go it alone .

A supervolcano in Yellowstone National Park releases around 45,000 metric tonnes of carbon dioxide each day. But a magma chamber beneath the surface is not considered large enough to produce these levels. Now researchers have found the source in a secondary magma chambers deeper underground. It's so large its partly-molten rock could fill the Grand Canyon 11 times over. It sits 12 to 28 miles (19 to 45km) beneath the supervol volcano and measures 11,035 cubic miles (46,000 km)

Australian researchers have tested their drone running companion. Called Joggobot it is designed to float in front of jogger when they run. The technology could allow it to track the speed and direction of the runner. And it could be used for other sports like cycling and rowing. The research, by the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology in Australia, was presented at the Computer-Human Interaction Conference in Seoul. There's no news yet.

Kimberly Calo, 41, died from a lethal mix of cocaine and alcohol at a Manhattan hotel party in January 2009. HOEy, who ran a lucrative banana importing business on Long Island, ignored Calo's seizures after feeding her cocaine at the ritzy Kitano Hotel. He also prevented hotel security from coming into the room as Calo foamed at the mouth, bled from the nose, turned blue and died. Judge Kevin Castel called him a 'self-absorbed, self-pitying, selfish man'

Freddie Gray, 25, was arrested on April 12 in Baltimore and died a week later from a severe spinal injury that may have been caused when he was shackled and driven to the police station in a paddy wagon without being strapped into a seatbelt. Unbelted detainees have been paralyzed and even killed by rough rides in what used to be called 'paddy wagons' It even has a name: 'nickel rides,' referring to cheap amusement park thrills. Police brutality against prisoners being transported was addressed just six months ago in a plan released by Baltimore officials to reduce this misconduct .

Villagers in remote village in Jharkhand state tie themselves upside down onto a wooden pole that hand hangs just feet above a raging fire. Seconds later they throw themselves into the flames while a Hindu priest uses oil to stoke the blaze. Locals believe the unusual practice helps protect the village from drought.

Luckily for Sprinkles who is too fat to even groom herself, she is being cared for by pet rescue volunteer Stacy Jones Olandt. She will hopefully lose a pound a month after being placed on diet.

Nasa scientists in California have revealed a distant image of Curiosity on the surface of Mars. It was taken by the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter from 187 miles up. One interesting aspect is that the rover's tracks cannot be seen. This may be due to Martian weather or they blend in with the surface. Curiosity is parked over dark sand in a valley with light-toned outcrops of rock in Gale Crater in the image .

Genetic analysis of two woolly mammoth remains found on Wrangel Island shows population was inbreeding. The last of the woolly mammoths were isolated on an Arctic island for around 5,000 years. They were forced to inbreed as their population dwindled and died out 4,500 years ago. Study raises the prospect of bringing the giant mammal back to life using cloning techniques with modern elephants. Scientists inserted more than a dozen of the creature's genes into the live DNA of an elephant using a new method known as Crispr.

The majority of the world’s volcanoes are found deep underwater where immense water pressure does weird things to the lava that bubbles out of them. Now scientists have finally been able to record one of these eruptions as it happens to discover the sound it makes. Rather than the explosive roar emitted by their cousins on land, underwater volcanoes give off a muted thrum. The research could allow scientists to monitor undersea volcanoes far more effectively than they have before .

The tiny nipper - measuring just 5.5 inches long - was caught during a 2010 government research trip and its body remained frozen while biologists went about identifying it. Sgt Louise Lucas, 41, was killed earlier this month when she was hit by a bus in Swansea, South Wales. She was on a shopping trip with her eight-year-old daughter Olivia when she tried to push her out of its path. Onlookers say the pair were inches from the bus but she pushed her daughter to safety. Sgt Lucas was rushed to hospital but doctors battled to save her but she later died. Police officers of all ranks paid their respects at her funeral in Cardiff today .

He imagines a space station of tomorrow similar to Las Vegas, with neon lights and plenty of attractions. In the main image of Space Vegas, a fantastic array of colours and attractiosn can be seen, including a Ferris wheel and a lit-up cowboy. The satellites will orbit the earth, covered in mirrors to help it harvest sunlight and convert it into laser light. The energy it creates, using semi-conductors, can be shot back down to earth.

Melissa Klein and her husband Aaron refused to make the couple a cake after learning that they were lesbians in January of that year because they disapprove of gay marriage for religious reasons. The Kleins were able to raise more than $100,000 from anonymous donors on a fundraising page before it was shut down for violating GoFundMe's terms of service. Oregon prohibits businesses from discriminating based on sexual orientation and the Christian bakers are were found guilty earlier this year. Seven buildings collapsed in western Sydney after suffering damage from the storm. Harkin skipped procedures and instead issued cheques, even forging deputy head's name.
Gareth Bale is joined by seven current Premier League players as well as three outfielders and a manager still plugging away in the Football League. Kasper Schmeichel has been named in three Football League Team(s) of the Season and has promotions from League Two and the Championship.
Luke Shaw joined Manchester United for £28million from Southampton in the summer. The 19-year-old has struggled to live up to his price tag at Old Trafford. Shaw has started seeing a psychologist in recent weeks as he comes to terms with his move .
Rebecca Rice, 16, had tried everything to calm her nerves ahead of her French GCSE oral exam. The only thing that made her feel comfortable was her 11-year-old dog Holly, her teacher said. Staff at Bodmin College in Cornwall have worked with pupils to help.
Capital One yesterday became the first provider to scrap cashback offer for new customers. Comes after announcement of EU cap limiting fees retailers can be charged for processing payments. Company has also warned existing customers loyalty points they earn will be much lower from June 1. Financial experts believe other firms.
Adriana Alvarez, 22, says that even with assistance from food stamps, Medicaid, and a child care subsidy, she is barely getting by, despite having worked for McDonald's for five years. Alvarez is a leader with Fight For $15, an international movement to raise minimum wage laws and acquire the right to unionize. The mother revealed in a column for Refinery29 that the first thing she would do with an increased wage would be to find a 'decent place to live' with good schools for her three-year-old son.

He had consensual sex with 16-year-old student in his office after she told him she had been abused by another teacher. Moore, from Ascot, Berkshire, was jailed for nine months on Friday after admitting two counts of abusing a position of trust. He was also found guilty of sexual activity with a girl aged 13 to 17 years .

New apartment block will contain five townhouses, three penthouses, a mews home and 21 luxury flats. Each townhouse and penthouse will have its own gym and swimming pool, as well as dedicated lifts. But it could face trouble getting planning permission as VIP neighbours may object to building works .

Thor Dalhaug died an hour after birth following a difficult delivery during which he suffered fatal brain damage due to a doctor’s errors, ruled Stuart Fisher, senior coroner for Central Lincolnshire. He said an unsupervised junior surgeon tried to deliver the baby using forceps in an 'unorthodox and unacceptable' way.
North Sentinel Island belongs to India and remains an enigma, despite being populated for 60,000 years. It is too dangerous to approach them due to their hostility to outsiders, meaning they are rarely photographed up close. When they do interact with outsiders, it usually involves violence - the indigenous Sentinelese tribe killed two men who were fishing illegally in 2006 and have been known to fire arrows and fling rocks at low-flying planes.
The drug plus chemotherapy has now been licensed by European regulators. Patients will have access via the Cancer Drugs Fund (CDF) until it is considered for routine NHS use. Each year an estimated 600 women with advanced cervical cancer could benefit from Avastin .
Scientists in Colorado have found evidence for a new solar season cycle. Every two years it appears 'bands' of magnetic field move to the surface of the sun. This combines with the existing 11-year solar cycle, causing even more powerful coronal mass ejections (CMEs)
Protein World's billboard campaign features a svelte bikini-clad model asking 'Are you beach body ready?' Campaigners launched a scathing attack on the protein supplement company after the advert began appearing on the London Underground three weeks ago. The 'body shaming' campaign has seen many of its posters defaced with feminist slogans. More than 50,000 people sign a petition to have them removed and a demonstration planned for this weekend. The Advertising Standards Authority has received 277 complaints.

Authorities initially said the fall, from a fourth floor balcony, was a suicide bid.

They are also being told to ask if patient wants doctors to try to resuscitate them if health suddenly deteriorates. Former FBI Director Louis Freeh was involved in a car crash last summer in Vermont. He was driving near his summer home in Barnard, Vermont when he lost control of his vehicle and hit a tree. Freeh severed an artery in one of his legs and would have bled to death in just 60 seconds. Current FBI director James Comey and Vermont Senator Patrick Leahy spoke about the accident for the first time last week, during an appearance at Chaplain College .

Marble-sized hailstones, some up to 2cm in diameter, pummelled multiple suburbs in Sydney's east and west on ANZAC Day. Seven buildings collapsed in western Sydney after they were damaged by the storm, with Fire and Rescue crews still working to assess damage. A woman had to be rescued from her car which had become trapped in flood waters following Saturday's severe storms . The storm was the result of an East Coast Low, which is also known as an extratropical cyclone. This type of storm has always occurred in Australia, passing through every few years, one scientist said .

Earthquakes of similar magnitude can have bigger effects on different parts of the globe because of the manner of building construction and population density. This is the fifth significant earthquake in Nepal in the last 205 years, including a massive one in 1934 that levelled the city of Kathmandu. Experts claim its shoddy infrastructure and poor building standards make the country less equipped to deal with major incidents. On Sunday evening the death toll had crept up to 2,500 people across four countries, with hundreds still missing .

Grimes Cottage is a heritage-listed 1830s Colonial Georgian residence with three storeys and six bedrooms. The 416sqm inner city block property boasts stunning views of the Sydney Harbour bridge from the front lacework terrace. Whaling captain George Grimes built the home along with a row of early 1840s terraces depicted in artist Conrad Marten’s work in 1843. Only one of two freestanding properties.

The storm rolled through the area about 4pm and a man was plucked from the waters by the Coast Guard around 9pm. Authorities also said crews still are searching for five people missing in the water following the Dauphin Island regatta on Saturday - which included more than 100 sailboats and as many as 200 people.

She was paroled last year after moving her daughter, then 5, to Spain when the girl's father, Peter Innes, was granted custody of the child. She defiantly refused to bring her daughter back to the United States and thus remained jailed for contempt of court. Her release came in part thanks to a letter written to the court by her estranged husband .

Mr Milat said he also lied to protect a brother, but was confessing to bring closure .

It is being sold by Hong Kong-based experts Evolved and is more than 95 per cent complete bone. The skull belonged to a male Triceratops that lived 66 million years ago in North America. A pair of ancient baby teeth found at two prehistoric sites in northern Italy belong to modern humans from a group known as the Protoaurignacian culture. CT scans of the teeth showed it had thicker enamel than Neanderthal teeth and was more similar in morphology to humans. They suggest it was the arrival of this modern human culture that marked a turning point in humanity’s evolution and led to disappearance.

Photographer Jeffrey Milstein has shot a fascinating project documenting black boxes. The project sheds light on what happens to the devices after tragic crashes. The boxes are usually red to help rescuers spot them among the wreckage of crashed planes and helicopters. They record flight data and conversations between pilots in the cockpit. Mr Milstein's work saw him gain access to air safety storage facilities where they are stored .

Hundreds of bodies were burned in the ghats beside the river today as families wailed in grief for their loved ones. As death toll surpassed 4,000, there began to be a desperate shortage of the wood used to build the pyres. The areas where cremation rites can take place are also short.
Lord Janner sent a 'thank you' Christmas card to a detective after learning he would escape child sex abuse charges. The officer said he was appalled by the Labour peer’s note after his superiors forced him to drop his inquiries. Director of Public Prosecutions Alison Saunders ruled that the 86-year-old peer should not face prosecution because of his dementia. The decision has caused outrage, with critics pointing out that he signed letters in the House of Lords as recently as this month. It has also been revealed that Mrs Saunders was a pupil at the same legal chambers as Janner – although she claims she never met him. Janner's barrister, the late George Carman, was astonished that his father was not charged after the abuse allegations became public in 1991, but he escaped the charge .
Rapper and businessman Jay Z launched a string of tweets on Sunday defending his premium music streaming service Tidal and saying that it is still early days for the app. 'We may not be perfect - but we are determined,' he said. Comes as reports claim that Tidal is being sabotaged by rivals as it attempts to take business away from more-established music outlets such as Spotify and Apple. The $19.99 a month subscription service is floundering in the app downloads charts and has fallen out of the top 750.
At least 65 British climbers and holidaymakers feared missing as death toll in Nepal earthquake reaches 2,500. Up to 18 killed and more than 60 injured when 7.8-magnitude quake set off huge avalanche on the world's highest peak. Aftershocks set off a series of further avalanches, prompting fears for the Britons among the hundreds of climbers left stranded by the tonnes of debris and ice blocking their routes. WARNING: GRAPHIC.
Sergeant Edwin Mee, 46, accused of raping and molesting 11 young women who wanted to join the forces. Alleged victims were new to the country and unaware of their rights, Southwark Crown Court heard. Mee has served in war zones in Iraq and Afghanistan and was medically discharged in April 2014. He denies 17 counts of sexual assault, three counts of rape and assault by penetration.
Stars Ray Liotta, Robert De Niro, Lorraine Bracco and Paul Sorvino were all in attendance although director Scorsese was filming in Taiwan and Joe Pesci, who won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actor in 1991 for his turn as Tommy DeVito, didn't show. Released in 1990, Goodfellas charts the rise and fall of Lucchese crime family associate Henry Hill, played by Liotta and his friends over a period from 1955 to 1980. The movie brought the 14th annual Tribeca Film Festival to a close. Afterwards, the stars recalled making the beloved film in a panel discussion moderated by Daily Show host Jon Stewart   .
Three-and-a-half-year-old black labrador Baylie lost a stone and a half in eight weeks on a new doggy diet. He swapped sweet treats and processed dog food for a diet of free range raw meat, offal and bones. Owners Margaret and Patrick Evans say he's now 'a different dog' .
William Shatner is planning to run a Kickstarter campaign to raise $30 billion (£20 billion) to build a 4ft-wide pipeline from Seattle to California. He wants to build the pipeline to transport water and solve the state's ongoing drought problem. But the proposal has been declared 'highly illogical' by some experts. On his website, he is letting people suggest other ideas for what to do with the money - if the campaign is successful .
Kristopher Hicks, now 27, was on his way home from a night out with his girlfriend in a taxi in Bath, Somerset. Michael Young, 56, had mistakenly believed Mr Hicks was planning to 'do a runner' and decided to drive him back to rank. But when Mr Hicks objected, the driver continued on for almost a mile, leading him to jump from the vehicle while it was travelling at 20mph.
The Ashbrittle Yew, in the churchyard of the parish's Church of St John the Baptist, in Somerset, has a girth of 38ft and a vast canopy. Locals fear it is on its way out due to wilting branches and falling leaves due to disease .

Instagram has also unveiled three new filters called Lark, Reyes and Juno. The most popular emoji on the site is the crying with laughter face   .

The presence of Blue Origin, LLC, the brainchild of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, barely registers in nearby Van Horn, a way station along Interstate 10. Few visitors are allowed beyond the 'No Trespassing' sign and a remote-controlled gate and into the desert and mountain environment reminiscent of the Air Force's renowned Area 51 in Nevada. The privileged who do get inside decline to describe what they've seen, typically citing confidentiality agreements. At the opposite end of Texas and the competition is the highly visible SpaceX venture, led by PayPal co-founder Elon Musk.

The residents were separated from the town by massive flood water and were holding their own unplanned service. Ms Newton plucked her cornet from the car and played the bugle call across the water's edge. The video has been viewed over 5,000 times on Facebook and has been shared online.
Elena Klimova, 26, runs an online support group for young people about coming out and dealing with discrimination. She regularly receives hate-filled rants from strangers telling her she's 'disgusting' and should kill herself. The activist fought back by publishing the messages on VKontakte, the Russian equivalent of Facebook, under the title: 'Beautiful People And The Things They Say To Me' She managed to track down the social media accounts of many of her trolls, and has posted their identities online .

The grisly discovery came just over a week after a newborn boy was found in a 2.4 metre deep drain in Quakers Hill. NSW Police were unable to locate the mother of the abandoned baby . Now locals Filomena D'Alessandro and Bill Green have claimed the infant's body in order to provide her with a fitting farewell. A service will be held for Lily Grace on Wednesday at the South Chapel at the Eastern Suburbs Memorial Park. Police are trawling through hospital records in the hope of identifying the baby.

But her co-plaintiffs in the case said she should not have taken part in the trial in Germany. They said they could not forgive Groening for his participation in the murder of 300,000 Jews at the death camp  .

Hannah Wilson's body was found in rural Brown County, Indiana, on Friday morning after a night out. Daniel Messel, 49, was arrested hours later and has been charged with her murder. She died from blunt force trauma to the head after being struck three or four times in the back of the head with an object. Her friends put her in a taxi and gave the driver her address, thinking she was too drunk to go home. She was last seen at Kilroy's Sports Bar in Bloomington, where Lauren Spierer vanished in 2011. Police said the circumstances of Wilson's disappearance are 'eerily similar' to the case of 20-year-old Spierers .

Mark Hawkins, 49, barricaded himself in Greyhound-style bus in parking lot of a Walmart in Salem, Oregon. Was approached by police, who believed him to be wanted for failing to appear on drug charge. Seconds later, he allegedly fired weapon from front of large vehicle, striking police dog in head. Bullet struck a police dog named Baco in the head, prompting exchange of gunfire between officers and Hawkins. SWAT officers and police fired tear gas at bus for seven hours before ramming armored car into vehicle. At around 6.30pm, police shot at Hawkins multiple times, killing him .

Researchers say 75% of extreme hot weather and 18% of heavy precipitation is being driven by global warming as a result of man-made emissions. They warn that as climate change pushes global temperatures higher, humans will be responsible for 40% ofextreme rainfall events. The scientists claim it is the rarest and most destructive events that seem to be the most responsive to human influence   .

Cassandra Fortin, 17, was diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma in September. She and her mother initially refused the recommended treatment, saying they wanted to explore natural alternatives. But in January a court ruled Cassandra could not make the decision because she was not legally mature enough and the state's Department of Children and Families gained temporary custody of her. Cassandra was confined at Connecticut Children's Medical Center, where she underwent six rounds of treatment that doctors say will give her an 85 percent chance of survival. She will be free to make her own medical decisions when she turns 18 in September    .

The Keshwa Chaca spans the Apurimac River near Huinchiri, Peru, in the Province of Canas. It takes three days to rebuild the 90ft long bridge each year using the same techniques as their Inca ancestors. The last Inca rope bridge was built in the early 17th century and has become a tourist attraction.

The St Ivan Rilski Church is the only remaining evidence of the community of Zapalnya, Bulgaria. Residents lived there until they were forced to leave their homes to make way for a dam. The crumbling stone structure now cuts a ghostly figure.

Palaeontologists are referring to Chilesaurus diegosuarezi as a 'platypus' dinosaur because of its bizarre combination of characteristics. The animal is proving to be an evolutionary jigsaw puzzle because it belongs to the the theropod group of dinosaurs - which includes the famous meat eaters Velociraptor, Carnotaurus and Tyrannosaurus, from which birds today evolved - but was vegetarian.
The EOssc2 is described as an 'ultra flexible micro-car for mega cities' and is designed to connect to others to form a train. It pivots using wheels powered by separate motors and shrinks from 8ft (2.5metres) to 5ft ft (1.5m) It is currently being tested in the cities of Bremen and Dalian, China. The concept vehicle is intended to be semi-autonomous and drive itself.

Buy and Keep launched in April 2014 for Sky+HD subscribers in the UK and Ireland. It lets people stream movies straight to their TV, or to their mobiles using an app, as well as receive a hard copy in the post. Films can also be watched across multiple devices using a 'follow me' function. New releases cost £13.99 and classics are £7.
Polish authorities said last week they would ban entry to the Night Wolves Motorcycle Club. Leaders called their plans to ride through Poland en route to commemorations a 'provocation' The group vowed to enter anyway and 15 were seen Monday morning at the border crossing between Brest, Belarus, and Terespol, Poland. Poland is extremely critical of Russian actions in Ukraine .

Conditions this week are set to be average for April, with showers on the way and temperatures barely in double figures. Colin Pitchfork was jailed for life in 1988 for raping and killing two schoolgirls in 1983 and 1986. He was the first man to be convicted on the basis of DNA evidence after being caught two years later. He received a 30-year minimum sentence which was then cut to 28 years in 2009. Former Lord Chief Justice Lord Judge ruled in 2009 that Pitchfork should not be released until the public could be assured it was safe .

Nasa scientists in California have revealed an interactive 3D map for Vesta using images from the Dawn spacecraft. The map lets you see features on the surface including craters, hills, mountains and 'canyons' You can also measure elevation changes and see different measurement data. And a 'gaming mode' lets you fly around the largest asteroid in the solar system using your keyboard's arrow keys. Various tools also let you find out more information.

Mark 1 version of Reginald Mitchell's famous design was among the first built in March 1940. Spitfire P9374 was being piloted by Flying Officer Peter Cazenove over Dunkirk when it was hit by a single bullet. Plane was consumed by the sandy beach and remained there for 40 years before it was discovered in 1980. It was almost certainly flown by Squadron Leader Roger Bushell, later 'Big X', during the Great Escape. It is expected to fetch up to £2.5million when it is auctioned for charity .

Spherical map of galaxy superclusters is the most complete picture of our cosmic neighbourhood to date. It will help astrophysicists understand how matter is distributed in the universe and provide key insights into dark matter .
Some 1,000 carved Moai line the perimeter of the 12 mile (25km) volcanic island, which is the most isolated inhabited landmass on Earth with just 6,000 residents. The 887 statues gaze inland across the island with an average height of 13ft (four metres) All but 53 of the Moai were carved from tuff - compressed volcanic ash - and around 100 wear red pukao of scoria. But it is a mystery as to how the stones were transported.

Researchers from National Chung Hsing University in Taiwan studied the expression of a class of genes known to be associated with petal development. They found that in mature orchid flowers, the expression pattern suggests two protein complexes, called the 'L' complex and the 'SP' complex, compete to promote the formation of the lip and standard petals. They were able to convert lips into petals in two orchid species using gene silencing.

The marketing co-ordinator recorded the constant whistling using her smartphone's video function. She also contacted one of the construction companies working at the site to complain of sexual harassment to the police .
Greystone Park Psychiatric Center, in New Jersey, was built in 1876 to house hundreds of mentally ill patients. It was once one of the largest asylums in the US, housing more than 7,500 patients and reached its peak in 1953 with 800 patients . It has long been abandoned and has been left to fall into disarray, with doors and windows blown out . Preservationists are fighting to save the building and claim it should be turned into a museum and housing  .
Research by wildlife charity the WWF identified 11 'deforestation fronts' where 80 per cent of projected global forest losses by 2030 could occur. The areas are the Amazon, the Atlantic Forest and Gran Chaco, the Cerrado and the Choco-Darien in South America, the Congo Basin, East Africa, eastern Australia, the Greater Mekong in South East Asia, Borneo, New Guinea and Sumatra. They are home to indigenous communities that depend on forests for their livelihood.

A Harvard-led study has mapped taste buds on a tongue for the first time. Scientists examined the different cells used to identify taste and watched these cells capture and process molecules live. Shining a bright infrared laser on the mouse’s tongue caused different parts of it and ‘flavour molecules’ to fluoresce. Scientists were also able to spot blood vessels up to 240 microns below.

Information about penalty points for traffic violations will be held only on the DVLA’s database. For many of the residents of Santa Barbara d'Oeste and neighboring Americana in Brazil's southeastern Sao Paulo state, having Confederate ancestry is a point of pride. Thousands turn out every year, including many who trace their ancestry back to the dozens of families who, enticed by the Brazilian government's offers of land grants, settled here from 1865 to around 1875. The party takes place up a dusty dirt road flanked on both sides by sugarcane plantations.

She stopped taking painkillers for the duration of her pregnancy as she didn't want to take any risks for her baby .

Last month, Nasa captured a 17 miles (27km) long iceberg being born in the West Antarctica's Getz Ice Shelf. B-34 is the 34th iceberg from the 'B' quadrant of Antarctica to be tracked by the U.S. National Ice Center.
Kim Davies bought the Tudor manor in rural Wales where Cecil Frances Alexander wrote All Things Bright and Beautiful. But he made dozens of illegal alterations, including installing shiny mosaic tiles and chandeliers. Davies, 60, initially denied five charges under the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990. He has now pleaded guilty to illegally altering Llanwenarth.
Ed Miliband sets out plans to scrap stamp duty for most first-time buyers, curbing rent rises and giving local people priority for new homes. But he also wants to ban developers hoarding land which could be built on, triggering a drop in the value of shares of construction firms .
New England Patriots coach Bill Belichick was caught on camera ogling model Chrissy Teigen's derriere at the White House Correspondents' Dinner on Saturday. His girlfriend Linda Holliday, who's dated Belichick since 2006, posted a photo of the incident on Instragram on Monday. Her husband, John Legend, was less forgiving than Holliday.
The woman, a single mother who reportedly works at the Philadelphia International Airport, is now facing four counts of endangering the welfare of a child. Firefighters rescued the woman's three daughters and a son, ages 9 to 13, at around 1.30pm Sunday after one of them called 911.
Queen Letizia and King Felipe met with the families of some of the victims of the crash in Barcelona today . The Spanish royal couple attended a memorial service in Barcelona's landmark Sagrada Familia basilica . They were joined by the Spanish Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy and 1,000 people. The memorial service took the form of a Catholic mass .
Prince William and Kate to use St Mary's Hospital in Paddington, central London, for birth of second child. David Cameron says he supports peoples' right to choose treatment options but praises NHS. Prince George was born at the hospital in July 2013.
American Idol runner-up Clay Aiken called Rep. Renee Ellmers a 'b**ch' and an 'idiot' on Monday's Howard Stern Show. Aiken, 36, lost to Ellmers in November's election to represent the Second District of North Carolina in the House of Representatives. Ellmers, an intensive-care nurse by training, beat a seven-term incumbent in 2010 and won a third term by crushing Aiken in November by nearly 18-point margin.
South West Trains forced to cancel all of its services following the incident this afternoon . A person was struck by a train on the track between Wimbledon and Surbiton this afternoon. Network Rail said staff were working 'flat out' to recover services but delays of up to 30 minutes were expected .
Fannie Randle, who has worked at the USC sorority Gamma Phi Beta for 24 years, was driving to work every day in an old car that was held together with duct tape. sorority president Alicia Jewell enlisted her sorority sisters to raise money for the housekeeper's new car on the crowdsourcing website GoFundMe to show her gratitude for her .
Dana Vulin was set alight by Natalie Dimitrovska at her Perth home in February 2012. The 29-year-old suffered horrific third degree burns to more than 60 per cent of her body. She spent two years and eight months wearing a compression mask to help put her face back together. Lawyers for her attacker will argue on Tuesday that she was not as badly injured as she stated in court. They are appealing for her 17-year jail sentence to be reduced to 17 years .
The $39.99 (£26) Nanoheat Wireless Heated Mug is fitted with a rechargeable battery, nanoheater and heat sleeve. It can maintain the temperature of hot drinks at between 68°C and 71°C (155 and 160°F) for up to 45 minutes. A built-in timer automatically turns off the mug if its not used for 30 minutes, to conserve energy. The mug weighs a little over one pound (454g) and can be used up to seven times before it needs to be recharged .
Crown Princess Mary attended Anzac Day ceremony in Copenhagen over the weekend. The 43-year-old chose a dark ensemble for the event, wearing a knee-length purple dress beneath a black jacket and gloves.
Economy will have grown by 0.5% in the first three months of 2015, down from 0.9% in same period in 2014. Latest growth figures will be released by the Office for National Statistics tomorrow morning. Tories have stepped up warnings about the risk to the economy .
Andrew Chan and Myruan Sukumaran will face 12 marksmen at the stroke of midnight on Tuesday. The pair will be led from their isolated cells in Batu prison through the dense tropical forest up a 3km steep winding track to a place called Nirbaya - or more appropriately known as Death Valley. They will be given white clothing to wear, which symbolises the afterlife, before beginning their fatal trek and are given the option to be blindfolded with a piece of fabric before facing the firing squad who will be lined up .
Mobile phone companies charge customers up to 20p a minute to dial what are free numbers from a landline. Net result is that millions of people dialling what should be free services end up paying hefty charges. The charges will end from July 1 under proposals published by the telecoms watchdog, Ofcom.
Greg Hardy's Bentley got stuck in flash floods in Dallas this week and he was forced to abandon it. The 25-year-old was later seen returning to the vehicle to collect some of his possessions in another car, a white Ferrari. The Dallas Cowboys star was suspended by the NFL just days ago for 10 games after being found guilty of beating, strangling and threatening to kill his ex-girlfriend, Nicki Holder, last year. Hardy will be forced to sit out the first 10 games of the 2015 season and will not receive his salary .
An estimated 26,000 people in the UK have HIV but are unaware of it. The 99.7 per cent accurate BioSure HIV Self Test enables people to test themselves when and where they like.
Tortoise retreats into its shell as two cheetahs get too close for comfort and try to scare it out of its shell. Big cats wander off in search of another snack in the Kalahari desert in South Africa.
Angus Hawley's brother David says he doesn't 'understand' the death of his fit and healthy brother. Mr Hawley, 46, died of a suspected heart attack in New York on Saturday. He is believed to have suffered a heart attack after 'returning from a swim' The former couple were married for 11 years before divorcing in 2007. He was a father to four children, all of whom he shared with Nicole Kidman's sister Antonia .
Apple sold more than 61 million iPhones in the quarter, accounting for more than two-thirds of its $58 billion in revenue. Sales of iPhones in China were also revealed to have outstripped those in the US .
